text: 2016 and Dragon Palace has, over the years become family.  It is my favorite AUTHENTIC CHINESE restaurant in an older but nicely decorated Chinese  restaurant oozing with ambiance.  Once you have been there a few times you will realize that most dishes they make are traditional Chinese.  If you like it hotter, ask for their chili paste to spice it up.  Every dish is wonderful and the servings are generous enough to eat family style and still have leftovers to take home!  The ambiance, excellent plain Chinese food and the friendly warm reception during service makes this a definite repeater!  Their pupu platter and hot and sour soup is amazing. All their dishes are delicious . The only one I don't care for is the crispy Duck.  Not bad considering all the others are amazing.  Don't think you are  getting PF Chang or you will be disappointed..  This is old school traditional Chinese.  My faves?? Last week We had hot & sour soup -soooo good with big shrimp and other meat!  Then I ordered mooshoo pork Oh and my friend ordered Pork Chow mein.  Of course we received the wonton strips with sweet & sour sauce to dip on and a fortune cookie afterwards.  If you are lucky and they have the , you will get Pisang goring (fried banana) to die for!  Although the place was filled, service was still good and attentive.  Dishes arrived promptly and were hot when served.  As always, we never felt rushed and enjoyed ourselves thoroughly.  Definitely the TO GO PLACE for traditional Chinese cuisine!  Update:  AUG 2016 Still my FAVORITE traditional Chinese food restaurant - and it's local for me!  Consistently GOOD, generous portions and quick friendly service! Great for take/out also. Life is GOOD!

Dragon Palace has been my family's go-to Chinese food place since before I was born, so it will always have a special place in my heart. I think I had my birthday dinner here for at least 10 birthdays in a row. Nothing changes in Dragon Palace-- the menu, the decor, the workers all seem stuck in a time warp in the strip mall's corner. But that's what makes it awesome! I will always remember the teal walls and the red booths.   Ok, enough reminiscing. Food- you should get the hot bean curd. It's listed in the vegetarian section, which is a total lie because it involves a lot of pork. But man it is tasty, and spicy! Tofu magic! The mushu vegetable wraps with plum sauce are also delicious and a waiter will come to your table and make them for you, which is fun to watch. Also, the free tea is awesome! It just adds to the whole experience.   Definitely a long time Phoenix establishment, don't be fooled by the boring outside, go check it out!

My family has been coming here for over 10 years and this restaurant never, ever disappoints. Each dish tastes like the first time. The owner Ken is a wonderful and respectful host. Thank you Ken, you had me at Shrimp with Lobster Sauce!

Eh, it definitely wasn't as good as some people write about. I did take-out...kinda pricey if you ask me. When I walked in there was a big mix up in the orders so it took a minute to pay for my food and get out of there. The chow mein was good. Fried rice was good. But nothing really stuck out as amazing. I don't think I'll be back anytime in the near future.

Our family decided to try Dragon Palace this evening for dinner. Having grown up in downstate New York exposed to NY American Chinese, and living in Singapore for 4 years, we are definitely particular and picky when it comes to establishments that attempt to pass themselves off as authentic Chinese. Dragon Palace is neither authentic nor quality Chinese food.  Let's start with the positives. The food was hot, and the pre-packaged fortune cookies and almond cookies were fresh and delicious. This is pretty much all I can say positive about Dragon Palace.  One of my favorite Chinese food dishes to order is Egg Foo Young, so I had to try their Pork Egg Foo Young. After my first bite, I was convinced there was no egg used in this dish. It tasted like a bland dry floury pancake--awful. They did not use the usual thick savory brown sauce that normally accompanies Egg Foo Young, and they did not add the pork into the omelet. Instead, the overcooked grey slithers of pork were piled on top of the omelet and there was literally no sauce other than a greasy oil slick that drenched this bland dish. Egg Foo Young is an egg omelet patty, and the chefs at Dragon Palace managed to ruin an egg omelet.   We had Cashew Shrimp--another family favorite, but Dragon Palace managed to ruin that experience. The sauce was over powered in flavor by the generous use of green peppers, but that was the least of this dishes problem. The chef used two different sized shrimp, but even worse, the shrimp was not even cleaned! The shrimp still retained their gritty sand vein --otherwise known as the "poop chute"--gross! This is a definite indication that Dragon Palace does not use any quality assurance in their food standard practices.   The Shrimp Lo Mein and Peking Lo Mein was flavorless as was the fried rice. The meat used in both the Peking Lo Mein and Fried Rice was chewy, and it left us unsure of what type of meat it was--very off putting texture. In addition, the shrimp used in these dishes were not cleaned properly.  A big winner dish for us is always General Tso Chicken--just not at Dragon Palace. The batter coating on each morsel of chicken was soggy and not adhering to the chicken at all. The chef did not use the slightly spicy sauce that is normally used with this dish. It looked like they had just poured heaps of their red sweet and sour sauce on top of the chicken and added a few red chili peppers. We asked for it to be mild spicy, but there was not even a hint of heat in this dish.  We will never order from Dragon Palace again. It is overpriced poor quality bland food that is far from authentic Chinese or even authentic American Chinese food, and not cleaning the shrimp is a deal breaker for us--who knows what other poor standards are being practiced in this establishment.

Hubby and I have lived less than 5 miles from this place for over 20 years and never stopped in.  Looking for good Chinese so yelped the area and Dragon Palace popped up with good reviews.  Comments about the outside are right - little corner spot in dated strip mall but who cares if the food is good....and it was!  We ordered three lunches to try out different dishes.  Both of us loved the egg rolls along with the sweet n sour chicken and the house chicken.  Not as thrilled with the beef and brocolli - nothing special on that dish so will stick with the chicken next time....and there will be a next time!  Don't be fooled by the outside - step in and try the food - you'll be back.
Favorite Chinese food.  the food is always hot when it comes out, staff is super friendly. Always come here when the family wants to hang out.

Really good authentic and fresh Chinese food . I like to come for lunch because the food is fresh , good and inexpensive . The portions are big and it comes with tea, egg roll and really good egg drop soup . I took a friend to dragon palace that normally doesn't like Chinese food . He really enjoyed his Kung pao chicken and will be coming back . Great service as well .

Very nice service here, but the food was NOT good. We had multiple items from the menu, and none of it was good. The decor is somewhat depressing.  All in all, it made us wish we were eating Chinese in San Fran.

Like everyone has said... It is in a crapy location. The food was ok, again like others said SALTY! You almost need to take a diuretic when you get home. They will not substitute anything for you. The first and probably only time there, I got the lunch combo and asked if I could substitute the hot and sour soup for the egg drop. The Asian man started screaming, "no subtooshin, no subtooshin, it say no subtooshin". I'm thinking damn, it was only a request. I said "ok", then he starts in with "hot sour soup very special, feed 6 people, has lots of stuff in it". I said ok, and he again said "I no subtoot, you get soup". Ok. Kinda funny when I look back at it. Maybe that is why it was me and one more table for lunch.
Worst experience ever. Avoid this place at all cost. Food is mediocre at best but the staff is miserable and rude. Can't understand you and are as nasty as can be. Will never done here again ever

Love this place! We've lived close by for years - passing by it so many times - but never ate here. Until last year. My brother read the reviews on Yelp and suggested it. It sooo reminded me of our favorite Chinese restaurant in CT. I love the Bo Bo Chicken. Its a little spicy with a very taste sauce. As others have mentioned, the House Special Chicken rocks! I found it tasted better when served at the restaurant. As take-out, it was a little dry. I've also found that most of the menu items that are labeled "highly recommended" are usually really good. Oh and for starters, the War Won Ton Soup is amazing! My only complaint is that the don't de-vein the shrimp! I've tried several shrimp dishes, including the War Won Ton Soup, and found the shrimp to still have the vein intact! Personally, that is not appealing to me so I don't order shrimp there. But truly everything else is wonderful. The service is also very good. Give it a try!
This is my favorite chinese food restaturnt, I wish they had more locations it is sooooooo Yummyyyy!!

This is by far my favorite Chinese restaurant in the valley. I am not a particular fan of egg rolls, but theirs are certainly the best I have ever had. Their lunch specials are great and you can get out of there for under 7 dollars during lunch.  The only thing that could be better is the location, but to be quite honest I would rather it be where its at with the current prices.

I visit this restaurant regularly and it's a family favorite.  The food is consistently good and the service is great.  We always get the Peking Chow Mein, Wor Wonton Soup and Orange Beef, and usually pick one more dish from a short list of other favorites.  I have never had a problem when requesting substitutions and they were happy to prepare  special orders when my son had to deal with some dietary restrictions.
Dragon Palace is fantastic. The staff is friendly and the food is excellent.  The potstickers are to die for and the chili dipping sauce is amazing!

Slightly greasy overall, but very delicious, particularly the vegetable dishes.  The meats are fine, but the Awesome Wor Wonton soup really has me crawling back for more.  The moo shu pork is great, but the vegetarian version would probably be fine too.  Service is great - while English fluency is not exactly impressive, it's clear that most of the employees are very careful to provide polite service with many "Thank you, thank yous".  I didn't really eat much Chinese food since I started eating healthier, but I'm glad I tried this place.  We've gone back 2-3 times now, and when people ask me where I go for Chinese food, I'm enthusiastic about recommending this place.
Good eats ilove it go go go?
Best Chinese food around!! Egg foo young, Mongolian beef, Chow Mein, etc. It is all delicious! I won't go anywhere else!

I will say if you have stomach issues and or haven't been eating out often, to possibly avoid eating here. I've had stomach cramps going on day number two, after eating here. My daughter has had a flare up, as well as my husband. The food is tasty but filled with grease and too much sodium content. If you're use to eating out then this may not affect you. If you suffer from IBS, Crohn's disease and or have other stomach sensitivities this would not be ideal for you.
Take out is quick and always super hot! Their orange chicken is superb! Would recommend this place to anyone!

Great place for Chinese food! Prices are fair and always has great service. Have been going here for years! It could use a bit of updating but the food is always good. Delivery service would be awesome!

Best Chinese I've had in a long time! This place was recommended to us by the owner of Hammered Hog, and I don't think I will try another Chinese place in the Valley. The service was excellent, fast, friendly and patient (sometimes I take a long time to decide what I want to eat). The food was outstanding. The Won Ton soup had excellent flavor and lots of Shrimp! I ordered the Happy Family - a favorite of mine from when I lived in NY. This is the first place I have found in the 16 years that I have lived in Phoenix that actually makes it like they do back East. My son ordered the Mongolian beef - another perfectly prepared dish. Dave got the House Special Chicken -great flavor - crispy and juicy. I also love Fried Rice - again, great flavor, huge portion. All the portions were large, the price was reasonable and the service absolutely fantastic! The only downfall - no delivery. :-(   They have been in business for 33 years - and I know why they will continue to be there for another 30!  I suggest you go there now!
Must order the chicken balls. Very fresh and tasty. The egg drop soup is very nice and the fresh egg rolls are delicious.
I got incredibly sick the night after eating here.  Ate dinner at 7- started vomiting at midnight and threw up(even if it was just stomach acid and Gatorade) until well into the afternoon.  Horrible.

Just got take out.  Not good.  Almond Fried Chicken wasn't correct.  Fried rice tasted old.  Egg rolls were stringing with some type of leafy, lettuce vegetables and over fried.  Sweet and Sour Chicken was okay.  First timer.  Not going back!

So we decided to try somewhere new and lets just say I just have stuck with the bad reviews... it was disgusting the chicken was barely chewable even my lkids didnt like what they ate.. the crab puffs had like a pinch of stuff in the middle there was hardly anything in there we ordered the seseme chicken which may have been the best of the 3 things, then we ordered  the sweet and sour which was horrible and my poor husbands teryaki chicken was a runny disgusting mess.. we will not order from here again..
The Chinese food was greasy and poorly prepared. The service was worse. Avoid this restaurant.

This place isn't bad. It's in a not so great location (tucked in the back corner of a dead shopping plaza) but the food is pretty darned good. You go inside and the decor is loud, yet drab. The walls are painted a striking teal, accompanied with a bright red. Yet it's not very well lit, and the lights look like they  need replacing.   Anyways, we went there for dinner and the service was fast, and the servers were friendly. Our food came out quickly and hot. I really liked the crab puffs. Very good. It was also nice to get free hot tea and water - something I miss about a lot of Phoenix Asian based eateries. The food wasn't too greasy and tasted great. The chicken chow mein tasted a lot like Panda Express, but wasn't nearly as greasy. On average, for this time of day, the avg price for a meal was $10. Appetizers ran the gamut from $2 to $7 (on avg).   I will definitely be adding this to my list of regular haunts.

We ordered take out from Dragon Palace last night. My hubby went to pick it up on his way home from work and it was ready on time. Since this was our first time, we opted for the Mandarin Dinner for 2 so we could try a few things. I have to say that I'm not a huge fan of Chinese food because it tends to be too greasy and salty for me; however, this was Seriously SO delicious! We were pleasantly surprised to see the take out containers packed full. The Mandarin Dinner comes with 2 Egg Rolls and 2 Pork wontons (greasy but that's kind of just how they are - the taste was good tho), Wor Wonton Soup (so delicious) with fried crispies on the side, Mongolian Beef, Sweet and Sour Pork, Pork Fried Rice, 2 Fortune Cookies and 2 Almond Cookies---all for $30! What a great deal! Let's just say we have leftovers for lunch (plus some) today.    I'd never had Wor Wonton Soup before and this was packed full of chicken, shrimp, pork, veggies all in a clear broth and it was so flavorful! I normally add soy sauce (actually I use liquid aminos) but that would have made it too salty. It was perfect just the way it was prepared! This was my favorite dish and definitely ordering that again.  My husband loved the Mongolian Beef - just all beef and green onions in a yummy brown sauce. Lots of beef!!  The Sweet and Sour pork was perfect! Sometimes I order S&S and there's overkill of too many onions, peppers, and pineapple, but not this one! They really focus on delivering you the pork! The only change is next time I'll probably request the sweet and sour sauce on the side because by the time we got it home the pieces in the middle and bottom started getting a little soggy.  The Pork Fried Rice is packed with pork, veggies and eggs. We were very impressed. So yummy!  We will definitely be coming back! :)

My wife and I tried takeout at Dragon Palace a few weeks ago and were really pleased. We ordered one of their specials, the house beef, and it was AWESOME! It honestly got better with every bite and we talked about it for days. We also got the hot n sour soup but frankly it was neither hot nor sour, but somewhat tasty (wouldn't order again).  We went back the other night and dined in and got the happy family---which was delicious and the seafood in it was cooked to perfection---and the Mongolian beef, which was also tasty and tender. We also tried a couple more soups and neither of us loved any of them---just missing something. Probably stay away from the soups going forward to focus on better stuff.  I love spicy food and my request for a chili sauce or hot sauce was answered with a funky paste of mostly seeds that had absolutely zero heat level to it---and I mean zero. I just wanted something like sriracha to kick it up and they apparently don't have that and in my opinion should.  Everyone was polite and friendly, and the owner (assumed it was the owner) walked around and asked how things were and thanked us---which by the way---many "fine dining" restaurants fail to do and it is so simple and leaves an impression.  We will definitely return to Dragon Palace. It's not PF Chang's in terms of atmosphere but when you want good food and don't feel like a big hassle this is the place.

I tried Dragon Palace after reading rave reviews here on Yelp. I rate three stars as I found the food okay but not great. The cuisine is Cantonese and I prefer dishes from the Sichuan province. I like a steamed dumpling and all Dragon offers are fried dumplings. I've had fried dumplings before at other restaurants and there are usually light fry marks on the dumpling's wrapper. The dumplings at Dragon seemed to be fried in a deep fat fryer. They were ok -- a bit on the heavy and greasy side. The House Special Beef was probably the best of the three entrees we ordered. The beef was VERY tender. The red pepper sauce that was served on the side was quite tasty. The Mongolian Beef was a bit flat and the Sesame Chicken seemed to be pieces of pre-fried chicken you'd get from Costco in the frozen section. Again, these seemed deep fried and not with a light, sticky coating that I prefer. The sauce was super sweet and lacked flavor. Also, Sesame Chicken is usually served with broccoli and this came with no vegetable.   I enjoyed the Chinese decor including lanterns with a spinning cylinder my grandmother used to have. Very Chinatown-ish as were the murals. However the bar area was very cluttered and seemed to be used partly for takeout box storage. The restaurant needs to de-clutter. It looked like health department certificates (home printed) were taped on a wall behind the cash register. Not good. Those should be trashed as well as the coin vending machines in the lobby.   This all said, the service was good, friendly and fast.   I like there is a pot of hot tea on the table. The fried banana strips at the end are also a nice touch.   Overall, Dragon Palace could use a lot of sprucing up and decluttering inside and dishes that offer a little more flavor. Not sure if I will return.
We order food for my husband 50th birthday we enjoyed and we will be ordering again thank you for making my husband birthday special

I've been to Hong kong, Beijing, etc. The food here is superb and the portions extremely large. We love it. The best. Words can't describe this food, it's wonderful. Every meal there is like a trip back to the Orient. You won't regret taking the time to dine here.
The Mongolian beef and chicken chow mein were very bland, and lacking on any major flavor.

This place looks like a hole in the wall. However, the food was delicious. The egg rolls are hand made and the sauces are very good. I think they use MSG but that doesn't bother me at all. Prices are good too.

I did my first uber eats from this place . Food was hot contains where super full  Food tasted as good as any chineese food place or better . Great value for you money . I would order again when in the mood .

This place brings back great memories. Of youth, fun and friends. A few weeks ago, I decided I wanted to eat here again. I had not done so in years (more then 5, less then 10). I took a new friend and ordered my old favorite, House Special Chicken. It was just as I remembered it. Crispy fried outside, sitting in a ginger and garlic sauce (I love it when food in a sauce is still crisp). My friend approved of her Sesame Chicken but I didn't try any of it, myself.   One bite took me back 11 years. To a very young man of 19 and his friends. Just coming back from a California road trip and stopping at their then favorite eatery. Ordering our favorite dishes, annoying the proprietor with our laughter and naive inconsideration (we didn't know better back then). Coincidentally, I bumped into one of these old friends there, this trip.   I wondered whether the dish was good because of the memories or because it was just, legitimately, good. So a few weeks later I asked if my parents would let me treat them to Chinese. Bo Bo Chicken, Yu Shuan Chicken & House Special were ordered. The Bo Bo was tasty. I wish it were spicier (as purported) but understand that not everyone has a Chicano mouth like mine. It kind of reminded me of Ramen noodles, the instant kind. I love Ramen. The Yu Shuan was good too. Meat was dark so it was juicy and flavorful but was also supposed to be spicy and was not. House Special was great, again.   What did the critics say? "It all really good, mijo." Success.   I wholeheartedly recommend this place if you want the takeout variety of Chinese food. I recommend Nee House more so overall but for tasty, stick-to-your-ribs, let's-get-Chinese-and-watch-a-movie Chinese food, Dragon Palace is hard to beat. The dark, quiet atmosphere and great service of the place is a big plus to me too, so I say, eat-in if you can.
My go to place when I crave Chinese food. Fast Delivery.

Love this place ! Been going here for over 10 years and average about twice a month for take away....  I'm pretty basic but love the Chicken Fried Rice (all white meat - best in valley) and Wor Wonton Soup as well as the Mongolian Beef... Just a great neighborhood restaurant with excellent service and food

Just ordered delivery for first time, wonton and hot and sour soup, singapore noodles and ginger beef. It was awesome. Timely delivery, tasty food and got the order right. Will be ordering from them again soon with hopes this continues!

Wow! For the money ( about $35 for two), the best chinese food in town, no doubt. The only thing is that the actual dinner for two could feed at least four.  Wouldn't go to eat in the area but we've seen the reviews on this place and decided to give it a try - it was worth it 100%.

Ordered with Uber Eats. Food came hot and fresh. Ordered the shrimp with lobster sauce, combo fried rice, and cantonese chow mein. Food quality was decent. Most importantly, it came HOT! No complaints.

The lunch special is not too shabby.  We got the sweet and sour chicken and the Mongolian beef.  The sweet and sour wasn't too bad but the Mongolian beef had a ton of oil on the plate and it was really salty.  But, for the price I think it's not bad and they have the lunch special on Saturday's too which is nice.  Most places only have the lunch special during the week only but this place has it for Saturday 12-2, I believe. It's worth a visit, don't let the weird strip mall and the sketchy parking lot scare you off.

You can tell this is a real Chinese restaurant. How? Every time you go, you see the same little kid doing her homework at a small table by herself. Lol.  The food is pretty standard, but good. We were introduced to this place by friends of ours. After our favorite Chinese restaurant changed hands, we were in need of a replacement. Luckily for us, they had found this place.   It's tucked away in the corner of a shopping plaza that looks a bit deserted; pretty simple to miss if you were driving by. Once you walk in, you see this old skool cash register...straight up vintage, probably circa 1952. I definitely appreciate how clean it is. The owners take pride in their restaurant. Normally, Chinese restaurants lack both cleanliness and ambiance.   The restaurant is beautifully decorated. And the service is outstanding! The first time we went there, I asked a lady who was waiting on a to-go order what she recommended. She said the Mongolian beef, which we did order. She was right; it was good.  Full flavored, and incredibly tender beef. I was thrilled bc I was able to get honey walnut shrimp. If that's a dish you haven't tried, you are missing out. I also recommend an order of their chicken wings under "Appetizers".   To enjoy a sampling of their food, we'll order the family meals. Expect to leave with leftovers. I recommend the Dragon Dinner Special. The wor wonton soup that comes with it seems to differ slightly from the one offered with the Mandarin Dinner special. If you're not used to bamboo shoots, you may dislike the wor wonton soup offered with the latter.   My husband said it had a weird after taste to him. I didn't notice bc I like bamboo shoots. The next day, the flavor of the bamboo shoots was more noticeable. As a word of caution: don't order an extra meal with the family style dinners. It'll just be overkill. And, you won't have any room on the table.

This place is seriously a hidden gem. If you haven't eaten here, you need to go there, like now. It's been in business for over 30 years from what I've been told.   The staff is incredibly friendly and they WILL remember you the next time you eat there. They treat my wife and I very well every time we are there. It's probably because we had our wedding rehearsal dinner there. That's how much we enjoy this place.   The food is always hot and very tasty. They give you hot tea, and fried wontons every time you eat there and are always very quick with their service. My recommendations are: Mongolian Beef, Sizzling Rice Soup (if you're in the mood for soup), Honey Walnut Shrimp, Happy Family, Shrimp Fried rice...I could go on and on, but they have so many good options.   If you're in the mood for Chinese and want a friendly and quiet place to eat, go to Dragon Palace!

I hadn't been here in years. Had lunch and got the shrimp in lobster sauce and it was delicious. Exceeded expectations for a well priced Chinese restaurant. I'll be back soon to try other menu items. Kungpao shrimp up next, maybe tomorrow. Yum.

First day open and I thought I would give Dragon a try. We ordered the General Tsos chicken, a standard staple, and it was good. The dinner was large enough for my wife and I to share and we were both satisfied. One downside, they don't have veggie egg rolls. We will be trying more off the menu to see if they are more than a one trick pony. To Erik B, the price is what we were expecting for a meal. By the way, customers from Sharpsburg don't have to settle for okay quality food. We actually like high quality food and can pay more for it. Snob much?

I have been going here since I was a kid and it has always been delicious!  It is tucked away in the corner so don't miss it!  It is my favorite Chinese food ever.  I have tried several Chinese food places and while they all are pretty good nothing compares to Dragon Palace.

Happy to have a solid Chinese restaurant in Sharpsburg! Everything we had was tasty, fresh, plentiful and perfectly prepared. Service was fast pleasant and efficient. Fair prices, we're instant fans and will be back often. Welcome to the neighborhood, can't wait to dive deeper into the menu, especially the "Authentic Chinese Menu".

I love this place!  Overall, their food is great and the lunch specials are a real bargain. The staff is polite and attentive and won't leave you waiting for much, The complimentary hot tea is excellent. I make it to dragon palace for lunch whenever I can.  The interior of this place is something else.  the walls are red and turquoise with gigantic  reliefs of Chinese themes scenes.  Its a family run business and not everybody speaks English, so be prepared to order by letter on the men

This place is kind of buried in a dead little strip mall opposite of Joe's Grotto and can be a little less than eye catching from the outside. Once inside, you can tell it's has been around for a while. However, I have been here 3 times with my family and every time the Kung-food and the service here has been no less than amazing.   The older gentleman that runs the place is always accommodating and friendly. My boyfriend is allergic to shrimp and they are more than willing to cater to his needs and make substitutions when necessary. The quality of food is always consistent each time and is by far the best that I have tasted in Phoenix.   They generally aren't super packed which is confusing given the quality of the food here, although they do have a lot of business on the take out side. We generally get the family style meals which include several delicous items. The one we usually get includes Wonton soup, the Poo Poo Platter (lol), Mongolian beef (which my boyfriend swears by), Sizzling Shrimp, House Special Chicken (best chicken ever), Mushu Pork, and Peking Fried Rice. And they top off every meal with these little banana filled glazed turnover squares.   Prices are decent all around which is also a plus given the quality of the food. I would highly recommend this place to anyone who would like a delicious, memorable and authentic Chinese meal.

Great food! Kids LOVED it too. They are picky.   Would have got 5 stars, but the service is rude. Been there a couple of times and they always rush you out. If you are talking to others at your table they will interrupt and ask if your done with your plate. lol. I've had them literally take plate before I set fork down to finish bite in my mouth. They literally stand and watch you eat and yes, quick on refills, but also pushy to get you out.   I'm not use to it. It's so uncomfortable to have them stare, push, and grab food out from under you.   The music and atmosphere is nice, just wish you could relax and enjoy it and not feel unwanted there. So strange.

I hadn't been here in years when it was owned by the prior owner.  What a fantastic dinner we had!  The place hasn't changed that much physically, that is, still the bright red walls along the bright turquoise ones.  This place is the stereotype of chinese restaurants.  But, boy oh boy has the food changed.  The food was incredible.   We started with egg drop soup, hearty and delicious at a mere $2.00  It had tofu in it too.  I had the shredded pork with brown rice (1.00 add on).  It was a huge portion but more importantly, delicious.  The other dish was a beef dish (name? ) Shi- something.  Large, large and delish, delish.   Prices are super reasonable and service is attentive. I will be coming back soon.  This place is giving great food with great pricing.  You can't get that in Scottsdale.
Delivery was promt, the food was exceptional. Will have to further explore the menu. Ordered the General Tso's, spring rolls, and beef sticks. I know what is lunch for Monday.

Wonderful experience!  The food is amazing: tasty, steaming hot, and inimitable.  The service is great, too;  we always get a table quickly, are waited on immediately, and they always pay extra attention to us.. In fact, we go once or twice a month and now know the owners, who are very friendly.  And they even know us by name, which comes in handy when we happen to place phone orders.   Before you even order, they start you off with hot tea, if you desire.  After we place our order, the soup is served piping hot, with those amazing crunchy pieces to put in the soup, or, as my young son does, to dip in the red sauce often used for egg rolls.  And speaking of egg rolls, Dragon Palace has the best egg rolls I have ever tasted anywhere.  Their entrees are exceptional and huge; we always have a "doggy bag" for leftovers when we leave.  The atmosphere is conducive to what you should get at a Chinese restaurant, with decorations, lighting, and music.  One time, when the music was not Asian sounding, my son asked the owners to change it to their usual music, and they did as he requested.  Dragon palace is the best Chinese restaurant anywhere.
Been eating here for 35 years! Lunch specials are the best. House Special Chicken and Shrimp With Lobster Sauce are favorites!

I play in Lost in Lies very often at Joe's Grotto next door to here, so every show night my band eats here before the show. They always take fantastic care of us, almost always with a table of 7 or more with split checks. The food is hot and fresh, the Chili paste is deliciously spicy, everything is just the way it should be. Highly suggest garlic chicken and house special beef.

If you wanna go into a time machine and go back to the late 70's early 80's and eat some Americanized Chinese food just like most restaurants presented it back then.  Then this is your place, all the way the decor to the food and the way they course it in their presentation is a blast from the past. P.S this was my grandmas favorite Chinese Restaurant.  We all ate here in memory of her on her funeral.   The owner is nice but you can tell this isn't his first Rodeo if you know what I mean.  He is very robotic now, but still nice. You will either love this place or if you like more modern places prob hate it.
This place is a go to staple in the neighborhood... Been going here for years and have never been disappointed... The house special chicken with white meat is what your looking for....

I love love this place!!!    As a child my parents brought us here at least once a week.  As an adult I live a little further away so trips have become few and far between.  Last night my husband suggested we go because I wasn't feeling well and he knows that their sizzling rice soup is my favorite!!!   It was so awesome to walk thru the doors and feel like I was back to my childhood, nothing has changed and the best part the food hadn't either still it's great flavor!!   Best Chinese food around!!!   Tonight we enjoyed the sizzling rice soup, egg rolls, cashew shrimp and pork fried rice..  You have to try this place, you won't be disappointed in the food or the service and you will come back for more guaranteed..

I popped in last week to have lunch with my friend and ordered from the lunch menu. Pretty cheap, less than $20 for both of our meals plus drinks and an upgrade to spring rolls instead of egg rolls.  The spring rolls were really good, fresh and hot.   I ordered the General Tsao chicken with fried rice and chicken chow mein. I don't normally order chicken chow mein because I don't really like it, the one I had here was A1. The chicken was tender and the bean sprouts actually had flavor. The General Tsao was flavorful as well, sweet tender chunks of breaded chicken.  The portion size was enough for both of us to take home left overs.   I can't really complain about anything here. The food was fresh, hot and didn't lack flavour in any way.

Been going here since I was in the womb lol. Edward and his family sold it to the new family and we miss them, but he at least sold the recipes to them too. Thank God cause this place is my comfort food. The sizzling rice soup is a fave especially when I'm sick and he gave my husband pick it up for me. The egg drop soup is just as yummy. The food is all amazing... Never eaten anything I didn't love. Nice large backroom for parties.

Excellent food. We had the chicken fried rice, chicken lo mein, orange chicken and moo shu pork. Everything was great. Came out fast, hot and fresh. We will be back again soon. Oh and also huge portions.

So I'm not a big Chinese food fan, but my husband is. Truth be told, it usually makes me sick. But if I were to go to Chinese food, Dragon Palace would be one of the places that I would go. The food is decent and there's a lot of it. I really felt I was getting my value's worth.  The waitstaff was attentive (always there asking if I wanted a refill) and the food came out quickly. It looks like every other Chinese food restaurant in the world (lots of red and gold, lanterns, paper Chinese Horoscope place mat -- save for the deep teal walls).  I'm not sure I would make a long drive to Dragon Palace because chances are you have a comparable Chinese food restaurant nearby, but if you live in the 32nd St. and T-Bird vicinity, this is certainly a Chinese food place worth trying.   As for the food, we ordered the Peking dinner for 2 which came with won ton soup, a pu pu platter (consisting of won tons - yum -, eggroll, a small fried shrimp, a skewer of glazed beef and honey chicken), Peking fried rice (fried rice with shrimp, chicken, pork and beef), Mongolian beef and the house chicken. (as an aside and a disclaimer, I am preggers right now and I have developed a severe dislike for chicken which means I, of course, hated the chicken dishes). My husband thought it all was ok. I really liked the won ton soup and the Peking fried rice. After dinner, we got the requisite fortune cookie ("Express yourself now." WHAT?) and a really yummy banana wrapped in a won ton and fried with a sugar glaze thing.  All in all, it was a good time at a pretty good Chinese Food Restaurant.

This is a very good hidden little gem.  Ive tried every Chinese restaurant in the area and Dragon Palace is the best, and not just because their food is good but because the owner is a class act.  I came to grab a carry out order since i was in the vicinity and noticed upon approaching the door that they didn't open until 5pm (it was 4:25).  I was about to turn away in disappointment when the owner unlocked the door and asked if i was just doing carry out.  When I said yes he welcomed me inside and took my order.  That right there is just fantastic business.   Try seeing that at any other place, you would leave hungry.... especially at a certain place on tatum/thunderbird that shall not be named.    I got the house special chicken, Mongolian beef, and small wonton soup.  All of them are piping hot, fresh, and delicious.  This is my go to spot for Chinese now and they very much deserve the business.

Entertained family who frequent the upscale House of Louie in West Covina, CA to the ultimate value...Chinese lunch.  I used to patronize Dragon Palace in 1979 when I first moved here and half the subsequent decade because 1) it was only one of a few  decent places in the vicinity and 2) it was damn good food, and still is in my estimation.  What a treat...why haven't I been back more often over the last few years?    One big let down at other places has been my former favorite, sweet and sour pork, as chewy, gristly over cooked lumps covered in gooey coating.  DP nailed it with tasty chunks of pork wrapped in a crispy tempura type batter...heavenly.  This large lunch for only $5.95 has lit a fire under me to remember to use this place a lot more now.  The only thing we need now is help from you advertising geniuses  to suggest signage to get people to pay heads-up attention and find the delicacies hiding in the back corner!
Definately worth the drive! New favorite Chinese restaurant! A hidden gem. flavors are great and food is abundent and soooo reasonable for that family of 4 to go out and enjoy. a meal out.

Dragon Palace has become my new go-to Chinese place. After having brought home dinner from here several times, Hubby and I decided to eat in last night. It was a totally solid meal once again.   The egg drop soup is like no other I have ever had- thick, savory, and eggy, with small squares of tofu and red bell pepper. I am normally repulsed by anything with bell pepper, but this stuff is so delicious, I can totally overlook it. This time, I decided to try the won ton soup, and it, too, was awesome- savory and full of perfectly cooked won tons with little nuggets of pork inside, topped with green onions. Delicious.   We also got the crab puffs- again, these are some of the best I've had in Phoenix. They also have regular and vegetarian egg rolls. I don't think the latter are on the menu, but just ask for them. They are pretty good.   I have had the house special chicken, the sweet and sour pork (minus the bell pepper, of course), and the three seas (scallops, shrimp, and chicken with snow peas and bamboo in a light sauce). All are very good, very generously portioned, and almost entirely meat. The scallops in particular were so well cooked, and next time I go I will have a scallop dish. Hubby has had three types of vegetarian entrees- the family bean curd, the veggie and egg crepes, and the mushrooms, peas, and bamboo combo- and he has enjoyed them all.   They do not deliver, but do a brisk takeout business. While we were dining, they had someone picking something up every few minutes. They are super fast with the takeout, even with special requests. You will wait only 10 minutes and have everything well packaged and ready for transport. Everything is still hot when I get home, even after more than half an hour drive.   Dragon Palace does not have everything on the menu that I would want in my ideal Chinese restaurant, but it comes close. Everything we have eaten has been good at the very least, and often among the best we've had in the Phoenix metro, and the prices are very reasonable.

My go to place for Chinese. I've never actually been in the restaurant but I order it delivered all the time. Food is fresh, portions are generous, not greasy at all and you don't feel like crap afterwards. Pricy but well worth the money.

I used to live fairly close to Dragon Palace, and my girlfriend and I would go here regularly. It was a nice place to eat in, as they were rarely busy. We also loved getting takeout here and eating it throughout the week. They have decent portions for the price so you could probably get 2 meals for each order. The fried rice was nothing to write home about, but there were a few dishes we really enjoyed, like the house beef.  I have a few friends who like it and one who doesn't. Don't expect to be blown away, but it's a nice, consistent hole-in-the-wall-type of place for the price.

Let me just say I am not going to use words like throw-back( except I am spelling it correctly unlike our reviewer down below...) or retro to describe Dragon Palace. Let's be honest and say that it has looked just about entirely the same since the place opened, about 30 years ago.   More positively I get greeted like family upon entering,( and I'm not Chinese either - Im a Korean who does not eat Korean food, and there's no inside jokes with the owner)  the service seems to always be good. I have grown up eating at this restaurant for years and can even remember being a little kid and craving their egg rolls. So good.   For those that were disappointed, did you forget that everyone on yelp thinks they are the next up and coming food critic and is extremely opinionated about their experience throwing in the quintessential yelp review words such as ambience or atmosphere all the while possibly mistaking outdated decor for intentional sarcasm? Or are you a picky eater? Or did you expect an overseasoned dish ala PF Chang's?   The food here is plain and simple. The bathroom is clean but could also be mistaken for one in a dive bar as well. The water in the bathroom faucet is insanely hot as the handwritten note warns.I am quite the drinker, but I don't go here for my drinks. I go here for delicious and salty Chinese food. I love the hot tea here, so my cocktail can wait until later.   Go for lunch, it's ridiculously affordable. You will leave full.   This is what I order:   (I don't mind that there is a small sized splash of what appears to be soy sauce on the zigzag border that sits just above the wood paneling in the booth. It seems like it has been there since my 10th Birthday anyway)    Egg drop soup. I like a thicker broth, this is the best. It gets better when you take your first bite  and there are fresh veggies like onion, red bell pepper and tofu in the soup. The fried wontons they serve with it make it even better. If I order egg drop soup anywhere else I immediately regret it, and crave this. It is definitely more egg-y than watery, but that's how I like it.   I only eat egg rolls from here. The wrapper is fried to crisp perfection Their hot mustard is the best anywhere in my personal opinion.   House Special Chicken( all white meat for only 50cents) Crab puffs, Shrimp and Snow Peas, Lemon Chicken, Almond Chicken, and The Mongolian Beef, are some of my most favorites, and they are safe bets.   Also, it says they don't cater, but my Dad just got remarried and they let us order enough food for 100 people with advance notice which was really nice.

I have been going to this place since the 70's when I was young.  Must have Garlic Shrimp. LOVE IT and crave it.That is my favorite but you can't really go wrong with any item on the menu and I have tried most of them through the years!   Also the owners are very nice and friendly.

Look no further for an awesome Chinese food fix. Service is quick without frills-as one would be accustomed to in a restaurant serving this kind of food-but is great tasting and portions are more than anyone could ever expect to eat-so plenty to bring home.

I wish I could give this place 6 stars.  By far the best chinese food in Phoenix in my opinion and the staff is super friendly.  I love finding local places like this instead of the souless PF Changs and Pei-Weis.  The candied banana won-tons are the best!
Decent Chinese food. Not overly impressed.  Ordered a chicken dish house special lots of dark meat chicken deep fried.  Egg drop soup was the best part. Rice ok. Doubt I'll be back.

Incredible. From start to finish Dragon Palace is one of the best Chinese Restaurants I have ever had. I ordered several dishes from Chow Mein to Orange Chicken and it was absolutely incredible. I think it is safe to assume that everything else is equally as good. Incredible and a definite must for anyone in need of great service with excellent food.

Mmmmmmm mmmmm!! Let me just say, I am not a huge fan of Chinese food but this place totally knocks my socks off! Amazing Szechuan chicken, great fried rice and wonderful soup! They even serve hot tea with every meal!! You won't be dissatisfied if you have a craving for good Chinese food! The waitress and waiters are very attentive, your glass will never go empty!! We will be back!
Luv this food!  Real food- not pre-frozen chicken etc. Bliq! I am picky- really picky! Delivered hot! Delivered with polite service! Best Chinese in the area!
One step above a hole in the wall buffet place.  Food was edible.  Very bland, service was very un-attentive and my egg roll was soggy to boot.  I'll take my money elsewhere.

It was just me on my own tonight and i was a bit later than usual and a bit hungry and when i spotted this place, on impulse i decided to grab some food to go.  I walked in and ordered at the front bar area, the place was quiet for a Thursday night, but i wasn't staying.  I ordered their dinner for one special and an extra eggroll.  I had a seat and before you know it my order was ready.  I thought hey that was quick, like lightning fast.  So i was suspicious if this is some reheated or a batch cooked for the expected dinner rush, Well i had to wait until i got home.  It smelled good in the car though.  I got home and cracked it open and much to my surprise everything was hot and fresh and delicious and even the eggrolls were still crunchy.  This place has their act together.  Maybe because it was a quiet night but fast and friendly service, and fresh tasty food, thats a winning combination.  Yup, I'll be back.  For takeout it was fantastic so next time i hope to eat in their dining room and give them the real test of great taste and service.
The Dragon Palace is clean and decorated nicely. The prices are very reasonable, the food came very quickly and tasted great. We will definitely return.

My wife and I come to this place all the time. The people running the place are legit and this is the kind of old fashiony Chinese food restaurant you wanna go to where it's a hole in the wall, mom and pop shop, but has that fabulous 1970's decor. We came here on Valentines for some love supper and were shocked by their wine prices. I think they were all $13.95 a bottle which is very reasonable for house wine prices. Happy family and fried dumplings are main stays for us. Everything is great so try it all. You'll have left overs for tomorrow too.
Good Chinese food. I've had as authentic as you can get and this wasn't bad. Nice staff and lots of choices on the menu.
My husband and I order from here all the time. Their shrimp in lobster sauce with shrimp fried rice is, in my opinion, one of the best things on their menu!!

The food was ok but the service was lacking. They never said a word to us other than asking if we were ready to order.   We ordered one of the dinners which came it's wor won ton soup (delicious!!!), egg rolls and chicken wings, pork fried rice, house chicken, and mu shu pork. The house chicken was a mix of white and dark meat and a lot of breading, and the mu shu pork came out already rolled.   The soup arrived and then everything came out very quickly afterwards and was awkwardly placed on our table in one corner in the way of everything else. We were constantly rearranging things so we could access our plates.   With our check we got a pleasant surprise of sweet and sticky banana wontons. The prices were reasonable and the portions were large as we took home a lot of leftovers.

New to the area, been looking for a solid Chinese food restaurant, we found it! We've only picked up but definitely want to dine in next time around. Nice to have a awesome Chinese restaurant in the neighborhood, thanks

Best Chinese food in Phoenix - 32nd St & Thunderbird.  The egg drop soup is amazing.  Our favourites - beef broccoli and sweet & sour chicken.  All meals come with steamed rice, green tea, fortune cookies, and fried bananas.

Stopped in last night and grabbed some food to go.  I read all the great yelp reviews and decided to try it.   Loved the meat dumplings!!  I usually don't like dumplings but theirs were great!!  We also had the honey dipped chicken.  That was my favorite.  They are like little drumsticks covered in a honey sauce.  They were so good.  I wasn't a big fan of the chow mien noodles but everything else was yummy!!  I want to try their dessert next time- the fried banana....looks delicious

1st and only time here.   Ordered House Chicken lunch special.  Egg drop soup that came with it was way too thick.  House fried rice that also came with it was too bland.  Chicken wasn't too bad.  Not impressed enough to go back.

A nice surprise, for Sharpsburg!  We gave it a try last night, take out style. They has quite a few orders ready to go, and about half the tables were filled. Big hello from the staff, very friendly and they seemed genuinely appreciate for the business. We started with steamed veggie dumplings, sort of the low point.The dough was quite thick and heavy - BUT they were large and filled with a very tasty blend of veggies. Trimmed the extra dough off and they were gobbled up!  Moved on to the main dishes - Szechuan beef (lots of veggies, great taste, tender beef), Dragon and Phoenix (tender chicken, shrimp, lots of crisp veggies) which was a little bland but very good taste, and veggie fried rice (plenty of fresh veggies with maybe some frozen peas and carrots) - again very tasty. We were struck by the amount and freshness of the veggies, the tenderness of the chicken and beef, and the low amount of oil used. Potions were plenty large (leftovers for lunch), food sat well with everyone, and the prices were good. I wish they had brown or similar rice but only white rice is available. The decor is attractive, the restaurant was quite clean, we'll be back for sure!!

So so so good!!  The dinner portions were so much for two people. The wonton soup had everything in more in it including beef, pork, and shrimp. The service was superb as well!!  Definitely will come back again in the future.

I love living in Sharpsburg, but one downside is the current lack of quality food options that consist of anything other than pizza. Thanks to Dragon Palace, this is beginning to change. Having delicious and reasonably priced Chinese food (with authentic options!) just a short walk from home is exactly what the neighborhood needed. I've been anticipating the opening ever since the "coming soon" sign was posted outside some weeks ago, so I made it a point to try the restaurant on their opening night. My wife and I walked down and decided to dine inside. The dining room was very clean and welcoming. My wife and I sat down, ordered some hot tea and began looking over the menu. The food options were exactly what you would expect from a Chinese restaurant, but I was really surprised to see that they included a section of authentic dishes to supplement the standard Americanized fare. I chose to dive into the authentic menu and ordered the Dan Dan Noodles with Minced Pork along with the Diced Chicken with Dried Pepper (served with a side of white rice). The Dan Dan Noodles were very delicious, but the Diced Chicken with Dried Pepper was a big standout for me. If you like spicy food, definitely give this a try. The chicken is nicely breaded and fried to the perfect crispness, and the dried peppers give this the perfect punch of spice. My wife ordered an Egg Roll and the Eggplant with Garlic Sauce (served with a side of white rice). She tells me that the Eggplant was very good, but the Egg Roll was one of the best she's ever eaten. We also shared an order of Steamed Dumplings, which is one of my favorite dishes whenever I eat Chinese. The Steamed Dumplings at Dragon Palace are very, very good. I could see myself having a craving for these and popping in for a quick order as a snack from time to time. They're that good! The staff were all very friendly and welcoming. Being that this was opening night, things got a little busy and service was a little slower than you would expect, but I'll give them the benefit of the doubt since there was a constant stream of takeout orders coming in and out of the doors in the time that we were there enjoying our meal. Obviously this speaks to the people of Sharpsburg being excited for a new neighborhood food option that is something other than pizza. I hope that this excitement continues and that Dragon Palace does well in it's new home. I also hope that the success of Dragon Palace sparks other restaurants to take a shot on Sharpsburg. Until then, I'm already thinking about the next time I'm going to eat those dumplings!!

Bland watered-down tea.  Wonton soup--sorry broth; wonton ok.   Vegetable mu-shu came in what looked like a burrito.  Had large chunks of egg in it.  More like a Mexican burrito than Chinese. Family style bean curd was good & rather MSG-laden.    One-time visit place.  Won't be returning.  Not sure what people are talking about with this restaurant being the best Chinese they've ever had.  Decor & ambiance very cheap feeling also.
Sizzling rice soup is a must. There isn't a bad thing on the menu, been eating here for over 20 years.

Love the scallion pancake and the spicy crispy chicken.  Try the special spicy dipping sauce, I now dip everything with it.  My dog Chops loves going there too, we always leave him some rice or leftover.
I'm new to the area and this is best chinese food I've had?! I will absolutely be back.

We had a lovely dinner last night!  Great portions, fabulous food, and kind service.  Our family of 10 thoroughly enjoyed each bite...left overs were just as yummy!  The House Special Chicken was really good as was the Sizzling.  They apparently offer a military rate, though we forgot to have it applied.  A very pleasant experience.
The food was tasteless. Everything I ordered had no spice even though it said it was a spicy dish. They also forgot 2 items I ordered. I don't recommend this restaurant. Spend your money else were.

Dragon Palace was definitely busy tonight, but everything was still fast and delicious. We got the salt and pepper shrimp and the General Tso's shrimp - both featured a good portion of very large and nicely cooked shrimp with perfect white rice. I know that is an easy hurdle to jump but sometimes to-go rice is dry or too sticky, so it's worth noting. I never had salt and pepper shrimp (or any other salt-n-pepper'd protein) but I will absolutely get it again. The shrimp was fried in a delicious light batter (with salt and pepper), and had a mix of garlic, scallions, and mildly spicy bell peppers. I absolutely recommend this to anyone who wants to skip the sauce, but for those sauce bosses out there: their General Tso's sauce was on point. Only criticism would be the broccoli was missed and in the future after their soft opening it would be a great addition to the Tso's. We're really looking forward to trying appetizers from the authentic side of the menu.  Overall I think this Sharpsburg family has found a new tradition. We're thrilled to have another restaurant to walk to!

I can't believe this little gem has been practically in our backyard all these years and I've just barely discovered it! Dragon Palace has some of the best Chinese food we've had anywhere in Phoenix. Tonight, we ordered the Mongolian Beef and Szechuan Chicken and were blown away -- delicious! Service was great, and our takeout order was ready in no time. We will certainly be back for more, soon!

Dragon Palace is the place I am most likely to go in the Valley for Chinese food.  It is close to my house, has a good atmosphere, friendly staff and good food.  The restaurant is standard Chinese American fare.  My personal favorite is the Mongolian Beef which is always made perfect with scallions and white rice.  Egg rolls are tasty as is the egg drop soup.  The meals always come with the traditional hot tea and end with a fortune cookie.  The atmosphere is old school with booths around the walls and tables within the room.     If you are looking for a decent Chinese restaurant with good food and no surprises, you have come to the right place.

This place is just fantastic.  I ate there twice this week.  One day we walked in 3 minutes after they had closed for lunch and they were still so kind to serve us and not make us feel rushed.  The food portions are huge and just fresh as can be.

The food is your typical Americanized Chinese fare. While not terrible it was also nothing to write home about.  The staff was not rude, if anything I think the language barrier might make things a little awkward but the staff smiled and did their best.  The reason for the low rating is the state of the building and cleanliness. It felt like there was no heat at all in the lobby/dining area. We were shivering during the ten or fifteen minutes we had to wait. The entire place is in need of a deep cleaning. Everything just appears dingy and dirty.   I feel like if the proprietors would invest a little bit in the upkeep of the storefront that I could give them a higher rating.

This is one of our favorite Chinese restaurants  in town. Over the years I have probably had everything on the menu. The sizzling rice soup is the best I've had. I usually have one of the shrimp dishes, my favorite being the Kung Pao Shrimp.

More authentic than places like Panda Express, but definitely not somewhere I'd go for quality Chinese food. I went with a big group and we ordered a variety of dishes off the menu. Overall their prices are low, but their food is rather one-dimensional. And they drench almost all of their dishes in thick sauces, making them feel greasy and unhealthy.  While the service is good and they have a lot of seating for large groups, the food is nothing more than something cheap and filling.

I LOVE Dragon Palace. I have been going here for about 16 years.  It is your average looking neighborhood, family owned chinese restaurant. They have crazy lanterns and blue walls inside.  The staff is always very friendly and helpful.  They will make recomendations and help you out with ordering.  Lunch is awesome...you can order from a list of about 15 dishes and it comes with rice, wantons, and an eggroll all for about 9 bucks.  Dinner is great too...portions are large and perfect for sharing.  I would definetly recommend this place.

We ordered take-out.  Food arrived lightning fast.  It was hot, each dish had fresh ingredients, crunchy veggies.  Everything was seasoned to perfection.  I'll be going back for more - thoroughly enjoyed it!
The Peking fried rice and Mongolian beef are amazing. Definitely the best Chinese food on this side of town. Staff is friendly and helpful.

5 Stars for "Old School"   Americanized Chinese food, in an authentic  funky retro Chinese restaurant environment.  Fresh, flavorful, and priced right.    My husband and I were sans children, and wanted something close to home, but different than our usual haunts.  Based on the Yelp reviews, I decided to give Dragon Palace a try.    What a great find!  I have seen this place before, when at the Quiltz shop at the end of the little strip center.  I am glad to try any hole in the wall or oddball place, but having had too much bad Chinese in the past, will usually not try one unless it comes with a recommendation by someone.    Hot tea and ice water arrived immediately.  We ordered 2 Dragon Dinner Specials- I the Almond Chicken, my husband the Mongolian Beef.  Evil, delicious little crunchy fried wonton strips showed up after we placed the order.  The Wor-Wonton soup arrived first- hot, and delicious. Beautiful clean shrimp were so flavorful, and the veggies and wontons were perfect.    The eggrolls were crisp and fresh.  The chicken drumette was crisp and flavorful.   Our entrees were so good, reminding me of the old fashioned Chinese restaurants I went to with my parents in late 60's-early 70's.  (Anyone remember Toy's Shangri La??)       Service was pleasant and non-obtrusive.  Here's an observation I made:  there was NO HINT of anything that had been frozen and added back into any dish.  I hate it when places do this!  The only downside was that we got NO banana wonton desserts!  I think it was because we arrived around 8:15 and they closed at 9, and were closing up the kitchen.  Now we HAVE to go back so we can try some other entrees and those little sweet morsels.

I was very pleased with my meal here. It wasn't fantastic but definitely good enough for me to want to come back and try some different selections. I had the Hawaiian Chicken. Portion size wasn't huge but was quite acceptable. Service was friendly and quick and time to prepare the food was good, considering that it was prepared fresh. I liked it and look forward to coming back.

Just moved to the area and was searching for a good Chinese food place. Was honestly a little off put by the exterior of the restaurant but once we sat down and were served I was happy! Pretty typical Chinese food, nothing spectacular but the prices were awesome! We will be returning.

We have been going to this Chinese restaurant for at least 20 years. It is always great. The sweet-and-sour chicken, egg foo young, egg-rolls, soups, honey walnut shrimp your name it, we are always very pleased. I have never had any issues eating, they always get As on their health reports and are even or on the Dean's list!

Our go-to for Chinese take out used to be Nee House. But as the years went by, their portions got smaller and their prices got higher. So it was time to find another restaurant.  Little did we know this AMAZING place was so close to our house! The great reviews online convinced us to try it.  The owner takes pride in all their dishes and goes overboard to please the customer.  Their ingredients are SO fresh. And the sauces are super-flavorful. All the meats are moist -- and that's hard to do with chicken. No matter what you order, you will be happy!  We will never go back to NH. We are Dragon Palace fans forever. And we've spread the word to everybody we know.

I called and order food and picked it up during the lunch hours, but I was charged the full price not the lunch price. I spend $32 on a little bit of chicken and a little bit of shrimp and 2 things of white rice. I wasn't even given the option of having fried rice instead of white rice. When we called to express our dissatisfaction, they simply said "We did ask. Sorry about that." We will definitely be going back to Tai Pei.

Disappointing  The menu was the standard oriental fare. The entrees were delivered quickly and at the proper temperatures. We did not find any "must try" dishes on the menu or on the list of in  house specials. The service was good, the food however, was not good.   On our First visit we had the, chicken chow mein, lemon chicken, fried rice, eggrolls, and egg drop soup. The egg drop soup was tasty, served piping hot and had a nice flavor. However, the chicken chow mein, lemon chicken, and eggrolls were not as expected. The coating on the lemon chicken was crunchy but the chicken was very dry and chewy not moist at all, as was the chicken in the chow mein.  The eggrolls were just okay, not memorable, and the steamed rice was somewhat on the cold side and lacked any flavor. The meal just wasnt very good.  Maybe, I went on an off day.  The service was geeat, the servings are plenty, and the prices are wallet friendly.  I just wish the food was better.

I have been in the Valley for over 40 years and I have to say, this was the worst Chinese food that I have ever had. I ordered the Almond Chicken and not only was the serving size small, and the chicken small dark meat squares, but it was so salty that I could not eat it. I sent it back. I then ordered Chicken w snow peas. This, at least looked appetizing. But, looks were deceiving. It to was too salty.  Needles to say, I didn't eat it either. I took it home and promptly dumped it in the trash. I have no idea how this place could possibly rate 4 stars. Plus the atmosphere is horrible and the staff very unfriendly.  Give me Wok Express or Flo's anytime. I only gave it one star because the soup was OK, otherwise I wouldn't have given it any.

Food here was just ok, and I'm pretty sure they are using MSG still. Every dish (including the house special chicken over which everyone was raving) was heavily salted and just plain bland tasting. Three stars awarded for quick and attentive service and reasonable prices. But I won't be returning.

Dragon Palace has become our go-to place when the family is itching for some Americanized Chinese food.    Like other Yelpers have noted, it's tucked away in a very diverse strip mall.  Yes, it's slightly ghetto, but I live down the street so I'm not scurred.  The servers are *very* attentive, almost aggressively so (not necessarily in a bad way).  They get the food to the table quickly, and I've never had anything that wasn't good.  The banana/honey wontons are amazing!    A bonus is that my picky eater always finds something that she likes here and she finds herself trying things she wouldn't normally try.

I was really in the mood for Chinese food yesterday, so I thought I would try Dragon Palace based off of the Yelp reviews. I ordered the Sichuan Tofu because I saw a picture of the Sichuan Beef on Yelp (submitted by the restaurant) and it looked delicious with the bamboo shoots and other veggies. When my dinner arrived, it was just a bunch of silken tofu floating in a bland, viscous sauce with no vegetables. It was so unappetizing that I couldn't eat it. The photos submitted by the restaurant are misleading, and I will not be ordering from here again.
I have been craving authentic Chinese food for awhile now and this definitely hit the spot.  Excellent food and great service. This definitely just became one of my favorite places to go.

Easily the best Chinese food in the area. Forget Jimmy Wans and Tai Pei. Cheesy name aside, Dragon Palace is authentic and delicious.   Ho fun noodles are fresh, flavorful and not too greasy. The diced chicken with fried pepper has a wonderful crunch with a spicy salt and pepper kick.   Looking forward to trying more things on the menu next time. If you're tired of the tired Americanized Chinese cuisine scattered around the greater fox chapel area, you need to check this place out.
DRAGON PALACE!  30 years in the same spot.  The best Chinese in town hands down. Hot and Sour soup, Mandarin Hot Beef, Mu Shu Pork, Garlic Shrimp. A+

Very welcoming and friendly owners. Lunch specials are awesome price and very tasty. They give soup egg roll and hot tea with your choice of entree. Its always hot fresh and a lot of food. We are there once a week if not more. You will be too :)

One word, "Awful". Nuff said. I ordered the crispy duck and the honey walnut chicken. Never seen duck and honey walnut chicken look not taste like this. I couldn't believe what they handed me as food. Terrible! This place made Panda Express look like authentic Asian cuisine. My duck was so dry and fatty. The walnut chicken was all lard covered. Ugh I'm getting a stomach ache reliving this awful experience. How this place got four stars is beyond me. I would've given negative stars if it were an option. This place is fuckin nasty bro
Love this place! The staff is so friendly and the food is fantastic! We live about 4 miles away and it is definitely our go to Chinese place.

I really wanted to like this place.  Really I did. The Yelp reviews were good, so I decided to give it a try.  When I came to pick up our order, the hostess at the front was very nice and there were many people in the restaurant.  I brought the order home, and it was all correct. I like the fact they put each container in a little plastic bag to cut down on leaks and spills. Plus they give you almond cookies and fortune cookies with your order.  But the food. Ugh! Unfortunately, it examples the worst of Americanized Chinese food. None of our four dishes - Mongolian beef, cashew chicken, kung pao chicken and house fried rice - really had any flavor, except the beef, which tasted of flour.  So disappointing! Won't be going back. One star for being pleasant and one for the packaging and almond cookies. That's it.

We found Dragon Palace thanks to excellent Yelp reviews, and it did not disappoint! It is like a little hidden gem tucked in the deep corner of an almost empty strip mall. We have lived in the neighborhood for several years but never noticed the restaurant as we drove by on 32nd Street. It is a gen worth seeking out for delicious Chinese takeout.   When I called in my order on a Saturday night we were thrilled to hear it would be ready for pickup within 10 minutes--wonderful! The good was ready promptly and was very affordable. We ordered 5 items and were charged less than $50, and had PLENTY of food for our group of 5, with adequate leftovers for the next day. Yum! The Peking Fried Rice was a favorite (so full of delicious meat), as well as the Mongolian Beef (so flavorful).  The decor inside the restaurant is festive and inviting. Best of all, the owners are friendly, professional, and greeted us warmly when we came to pick up the food. Thank you, Dragon Palace! We will be back!

What a nice little "gem of a restaurant" to answer our craving for Asian  food!  Thanks Yelpers!!!  The food and service at this place are China-licious!  The prices are just $, a bargain!  The Dragon Palace is tucked away in the corner of an older strip center on the east side of N 32rd just north of E Thunderbird.  It looks like it's been here for years, and I mean a lot of years...  But don't let deter you from trying the Dragon Palace!  Restaurant~ the decor is old.  It's is a thrown back into the late seventies and early eighties with huge red vinyl booths with the high backs.  The walls are solid blue (I guess as a contrast maybe?) with some Asian inspired borders and prints.  They have those old Asian lamps hanging for the ceiling.  Although this place is a through back into time of another era, the place is very clean and comfy.    Service~ excellent from when you enter their restaurant until you leave.  5 star service.  Food~ all of their lunch meals come with water and hot tea, complimentary.  They also offer the usual beverage choices if you so desire something else.  The hot tea was very good!    Their menu is also a through back to old Asian restaurants I used to go to when I was a kid.  I remember when mom would say "we are going to go and eat Chinese" and I would say "mom, we're not cannibals do you mean Asian or Chinese food?"    After a slap on the back of the head we were off ~ ready to get stuffed since they always brought you way too much food.  All of their lunch meals here at the Dragon Palace come with a very tasty bowl of egg drop soup (thick and tasty!), wontons, egg roles, rice is fried or steamed  and the main entree.  We had their Beef with Broccoli and their Mongolian Beef.  Both dishes were China-licious!!  Our entire meal was less than $20 with the tip!  I'm looking forward to going "Back in Time" at he Dragon Palace again real soon.  Hopefully I will see you there.

Gave it two stars because the service is so good. Called for take out and they knew what they were doing, understood me and all was good, service with a smile too.   Ordered the B meal for two, so egg rolls, S+S chicken balls, chicken chow mein and chicken fried rice. Food is poor at best. Monumentally bland (and I am not a SPICE ON EVERYTHING guy), no flavour at all. Chow mein is light on the chicken to say the least and the chicken balls are all breading.  Will not try them again.

I tried this place out all because of Shane's ROTD and yep it lived up to its greatness. I ordered a appetizer platter, twice cooked pork and pork fried rice. (Apparently I was craving pork which is beyond rare) Man all of the food was really good. The egg rolls were stuffed with yummy goodness, the honey chicken was finger-licking good, there was TONS of pork fried rice packed into that container. My goodness was it stuffed. The only disappointment was the twice cooked pork. Don't get me wrong it was good, but when I ask for extra, extra spicy, that is exactly what I am expecting and it fell short. :(  But will it stop me from going back,? heck no. I am already thinking about what I will be ordering this coming weekend.

VERY dissatisfied and disappointed with this establishment, I have been going here for a while now and they seem like decent people and the food was decent up until last night when I started eating my food and there was a bunch of egg shell in it, so I didn't eat it, I called and told the owner or manager, his reply was bring the food in from last night and show him the egg shell, are you joking me? Not only have you lost a customer and customers, now you have lost a devoted customer over what, because you didn't want to make a customers order right and basically accuse them of lying? I have spent countless money, hard earned money in your inflated priced establishment and now you have lost it over an order of chicken fried rice lol what a disgrace!

My family and I have been going here for years and it is always a wonderful experience.  Their food is wonderful... the staff is great... and the meals are decently priced and large enough to share with everybody in your party.  Definitely recommended!!!

I can't figure out HOW we made such a mistake with this place, with such good reviews. First, it was expensive ($30 for takeout- a sesame chicken, a schezuan chicken, and fried rice... I was expecting a tab closer to $21-25 with tax.)   When we got our takeout home, we were hopeful. All of my fellow Yelper's reviews were so glowing. Now I'm convinced that every person who rated it with 5 stars was paid to do so or came just for the tea and fortune cookies- but I'm not sure as we didn't eat in.   Our food was inedible. I'm serious- and usually once I've shelled out a few bucks for something I'll at least hunker down and eat it, but instead I'd rather go hungry tonight. And my husband will eat ANYTHING, so for him not to touch his dish is pretty reassuring to me that I'm not just some crazy snob who doesn't like the food (and Chinese is never a bad choice for me, I've never given up.) The sesame chicken tasted like soggy chicken nuggets. Bland and mushy. The schezuan chicken clearly was made up of canned chicken. Tiny nondescript bits of white meat that seemed extremely processed (not fresh at all), and in some sort of spicy-ketchup sauce. The fried rice was the only thing I would consider worth eating, but was full of the same canned-chicken processed crap. I'm serious, you could almost confuse the meat here for "Chicken of the Sea." Same preserved flavor, and that's not the MSG talking.  Maybe we ordered the wrong things, I don't know, but we literally took about 3 bites each and stared in remorse at our inedible dinner, as we contemplated calling for a refund or going out for a frozen pizza.   Never again will I eat here. They were SO nice- SO nice. That's about the only remarkable thing about this place. Unlike other Yelpers, I would try ANY other place in the valley before returning for more of the same here.

I've lived in the neighborhood for more than 20 years, and just found this place. Wish I'd of known of it before. The food is consistently delicious. Since we found out that they were right down the street, we have eaten here half a dozen times. Only once were we not overly impressed, and it was a take out order, on a busy night.   Worth trying if you are in the mood for Chinese!

Having moved from Seattle to Phoenix, I ate for many years in the International District and know how good Chinese food is supposed to taste. The Dragon Palace does a great job with most of my favorite dishes!   The A ratings from the County Health Inspector paper the wall when you walk in, inspiring confidence!  Service is quick and accurate.   Our favorites... Wor Wonton Soup crammed with seafood, and wontons. Yummy anytime but especially when you are sick! We always send the other person out to pick this up when we get a cold.  Mongolian Beef is fork tender and the Lo Mein (pan fried soft noodle) dishes are filling and delicious. I don't understand why the AZ Republic food critics don't include this place on their "Best Chinese" list! Tell them to get in there!

I am excited to have a new restaurant in our neighborhood and tried it on opening day. They did a great job with the interior and it was clean and decorated nicely.
