The menu was well thought out in my opinion. Prices are reasonable and the location is great as we really don't have many good quality food choices to pick from yet that we can walk to. It was so nice to be able to walk to get good food. The egg rolls and dumplings were some of the best I've ever had. They weren't greasy and I love they have an authentic menu as well as healthy options. I really liked the eggplant I ordered. The portions were generous and I have some left for 2 more meals! My husband ordered food off of the authentic menu and really liked it. It will be my go-to for Chinese food and Sharpsburg definitely deserves a great restaurant like this!

Felt the urge for some good Chinese food without having to sit uncomfortably at a restaurant. I checked yelp to find some local restaurants to get my fix and came across the dragon palace.   After logging onto their website and taking a look at their menu it looked pretty standard so I called them up and placed my order. The person on the phone spoke great English (Ive ordered from other Chinese restaurants and had a troubles) so placing my order was super easy. They asked me how long I wanted my food in and if it was for delivery or pickup.  Within 15 minutes I was at the dragon palace it was really easy to find located directly on Dundas and there was a lot of parking. I found out as per their menu that if you pay cash they give you 10% off which made me really happy. All the food was neatly packed in a large paper bag. They packed up forks and knives along with napkins and a variety of sauces for my food. I was really please with my food and would definitely go back!!! I had left overs for days there was a lot food.

After seeing Amy P's review of this place I had to give my own. If you have read my other reviews it is plain to see I think I know what I am talking about when it comes to food. So, being a true NYer and a good Jew I love Chinese food. It's Kosher, right? Anyway, I have had my fair share of it and Dragon Palace stands up to almost all of it, save Chinese food in Seattle.   It is located in the corner of a strip mall, which Megan M pointed out is a little shady. Couldn't be more spot on. There is a bar in the opposite corner and run-down looking car wash close by. Putting that aside it is your stereotypical Chinese restaurant. It smells great when you walk in and there are a couple of cheap candy and toy machines right when you walk in. You are always greeted by the owner, who speaks passable and sometimes unintelligible English. Most of the time I am picking up food to go, but when I have eaten here the service has been very quick and attentive. It is good for big groups too.  No matter what you like in the way of Chinese food you will find it here. Everything I have eaten has been very good. The soups, appetizers, and main dishes are all consistent each time I order them, which is what I look for in a good eatery.   My favorites include the egg rolls, wonton soup, mo shu pork, house special chicken, mongolian beef, and lemon chicken.  The only thing that bugs me about this place, is what gets my Dad riled up every time we order from them. So after getting food from here for about 10 years my Dad started to notice that the bill was always ending in .0, .05, or .10 increments. So, this one time my Dad decided to figure out the bill himself, tax and all. When we went to pick up the food he argued with the owner for about 10 minutes about the fact that they were rounding up on the tax. It may have only been a few cents, but it pissed my Dad off. The owner said that they "don't deal in penny." My Dad retorted with, "Well the IRS does." The owner told him he was a big problem and would remember his name. He proceeded to storm off and cuss my Dad out in Chinese. To this day my Dad doesn't use his name to place pick up orders. It is still a running joke in my family. After all this we still order from them.
The egg drop is the best!  We have not had one bad meal yet. From start to finish... Darn good

So five stars for the food. I will be coming here to order take out. The service, the environment and ambiance is a different story. We came with our baby and we felt so unwelcome. They offered a high chair and it was the most unsafe and annoying high chair I've ever seen. It came with a silver pan tray so anytime she pounded on the tray, it would make this loud sound that bounced off the walls. It was quite annoying and people in the restaurant seemed annoyed too. So we told the waitress we will just order take out, which made us feel more awkward while we waited for our food and service practically ended while the employees just watched us - my hubby sitting down in the booth and me trying to console my fussy daughter, walking in the front of the restaurant. Awkward.   We ordered the shrimp fried rice, the shrimp with lobster sauce and house special beef. The food was delicious! The fried rice had whole, tender, succulent shrimps. I was pretty satisfied. I just know I'll be just ordering take out and not dining in next time.

I think I have found my favorite Chinese restaurant in Phoenix! Dragon Palace is everything I think of when it comes to Chinese food. The restaurant is full of traditional decorations and of course those large red booths. (They have tables too). Soft Chinese music playing in the background and some artwork.   Let's move on to the food...Dragon Palace has Mandarin and Szechuan dishes. The food is so good that I came in two weeks in a row.   We started with fried meat dumplings and crab puffs. Oh both are delicious and served with sweet and sour and hot chili sauces. We also had sizzling rice soup. One of the best Chinese soups I have ever had with chicken, shrimp and veggies. They also bring out complimentary fried wonton strips with dipping sauce to every table.   For dinner we had house special chicken which is lightly fried chicken breast sauted in "special sauce". I don't know what this special sauce is, but I would drink it if I could. Yummy!  We also tried the sauted happy family which is chicken, beef, shrimp, scallops and Chinese veggies all together covered in a brown sauce. Delicious! The brown sauce has a great flavor and is slightly sweet. They also don't skimp on any of the meat or seafood. I was impressed!   We did not try dessert, but they bring out complimentary banana wontons covered in honey with the check. Oh these are good!! Can I have more than one please!?  Another thing to mention is the full bar. When I go out for Chinese food I never think of ordering a cocktail. Dragon Palace had a pretty impressive cocktail menu. I didn't have a cocktail, but several people in the restaurant did and the drinks looks really good. I'll be sure to try one next time!  Enjoy!

Very excited for this addition to Sharpsburg. We ordered the Singapore rice noodles, my daughter's favorite, and it was excellent! Look forward to trying more of their options very soon. The dining area is decent--it's a converted pizza place. Good for a family night out or to grab some delicious takeout. Welcome to the neighborhood, Dragon Palace!
Great food! A little expensive but I don't mind treating my family once in a while friendly staff place seems clean,

Amazing food! We were recommended this place. WOW We will be back again! Everything we had was awesome! I had Shrimp Egg Foo Young patties. Boyfriend had Shrimp fried rice, Sesame chicken. We also got egg rolls!
This is our favorite Chinese restaurant. The food is delicious and the price is right. They are fast and always quite friendly.
Not the same restaurant from a few years back.  We went on Christmas Eve and the food was horrible. Restroom smells foul.  The whole place did moot feel clean

Dragon Palace is your stereotypical, neighborhood Chinese restaurant. It's back in the corner of a shady looking strip mall, which doesn't exactly draw you in. The restaurant itself is decorated with rather gaudy, gold and red decorations, complete with red paper lanterns.  Although I don't come here for the atmosphere, I wish one of these days they'd put a sound system in and play some background music. Despite the less-than-elegant decor, this restaurant has a certain charm to it.  I've been coming here with my family for about 20 years and it's still my restaurant of choice for Chinese food. The egg rolls and crab puffs are pretty tasty, but my favorite appetizer is the egg drop soup. It's thick, flavorful and I have yet to find a rival anywhere. Great dishes include the Mongolian beef, cashew chicken and house special chicken. Americans everywhere have their favorite, must order Chinese food dish and I'm willing to bet you'll find a pleasant version of it at Dragon Palace.   The best time to go is at lunch! It's quick and cheap. Their lunches, which come with a generous helping of your choice of dish (say kung pao chicken), rice, egg roll, 2 wontons and either egg drop or wonton soup are less than $6, most around $5. If you're REALLY on a budget, order a bowl of egg drop soup for only $1.   The only thing you can't get at lunch time is their after-dinner, Banana Caramel Delights! They drop one off for each person with the check.This isn't the actual name for them, but as they are complimentary and not on the menu, I'm not sure what they are called. They are basically banana filled crispy wonton wrappers that are then coated in a crunchy, sugary, caramel coating. If you like bananas and sweet things, you'll love these!   If you're craving Chinese food, stop and eat here or pick up a to-go order and eat it in whatever environment you choose!

Wonderful service and excellent food!  Everything we've ordered has been great.  Our favorites, include the "Happy Family" (seafood menu), cheese puffs, veggie egg rolls, Mongolian beef, sweet & sour chicken,  fried rice, and garlic chicken.  We feel the portions are generous and the prices very reasonable.  If you haven't tried it, we recommend you do!

First off....I'm a rabbit! This according to every Chinese Zodiac.  I like being a rabbit. My opposite.....the cock! My wife apparently is a cock. So for eighteen years I have loved .....well, my Wife!   Dragon Palace has been around for a VERY long time. I remeber going there as a child and loving it. One of my daughters has been in gymnastics just west of this restaurant and I keep wanting to eat here again and I continually drive by without stopping. My family generally eats at Nee-House or Jade Palace but the nostalgia here had my curiousity piqued.   This past weekend I made an executive choice. "Family" I said, "We are going to Dragon Palace tonight for dinner" I was so excited. This was going to be a huge throwback to my childhood. So we arrive and so goes!  We walk up to two Chinese Red colored doors. I remember these doors being gigantic, not so big anymore when you are 6' tall. I open the door for my family to enter and the wonderfull smell wafed by my nose. Just the smell I remember, a true chinese smell. When we entered there was an old Chinese man at the front counter. I wonder if he was here 25 years ago? The lanterns adorned the rooftop just like I remember back in the eighties. Pink and blue hues were splashed on the walls. No frills, just the iconic, eclectic and stereotypical Chinese joint. So far everything is great. Now the food has to be good. And it was. I must say I was peased big time. I am a very adventurous eater usually. NOT TONIGHT. I wanted simple traditional Americanized chines fair and they hit on all levels. Wor Wonton Soup, Egg Foo Yung, Mongollion Beef, Orange Chicken, Low Mein (house), Crab Puff and Egg Rolls. Easy comfort stuff. It was very good, very fresh.   Dragon Palace always served a "treat" at the end of the meal. Ice Cream usually. Now it appears they serve a new and even better treat after the meal. Get this, Banana, wrapped in wonton skin, deep fried and drizzled with honey. Crispy, Chewy, Golden and sweet. Those little chats are off the map. Loved it and we will be back soon!!!
Great Chinese food, delivered. Super friendly staff. We've ordered 3 times and it hasn't missed a beat once. Highly recommend!

Pros: good value for money lots of choices and variety  Very prompt service Owner came by to see if we were having a good experience   Cons :  Location not very appealing  Staff not very friendly.   Had the Dragon Dinner Special. For 2. Mongollian beef, tender beef with scallions, a bit on the bland side but I like spicy, so I fixed it by adding chili oil and all was great. Really good Fried rice. Egg roll and honey chicken wing, all started with work won ton soup.  We also had house special chicken.  Very good.  Will go back.
It's great food.  Meal includes Hot Tea shouldn't all Chinese restaurants include hot tea. Just saying!! All the classic dishes, clean and delicious.

I'm a big fan of hot and sour soup, and a bit of a snob about it since I have eaten so much of it. At first I didn't think I would like the soup when it came out because I tend to like broth that is darker and richer looking, and this broth seemed a little light for my tastes (I want a hybrid broth + sauce) but it was delicious! Flavorful and chock full of good things, I was definitely a fan. I also got some fried dumplings that were pretty good, although there's a place in Huntington Beach that makes them just the way I like them and I have yet to find a good replacement, and my brother got a beef dish that he really enjoyed. All in all it was a good experience, very authentic, and the people were nice albeit not overly friendly.

My partner and I came here to grab a take-away for dinner, because we looked up prices online and Dragon Palace seemed really affordable, and we didn't really want fast food.  I had a dinner combo that came with chicken fried rice, General Tso's chicken, chicken chow mein, and an egg roll; he had sweet and sour chicken balls, chicken fried rice, and switched out his chow mein for noodles since he couldn't switch out his rice. We both had egg rolls that had a vegetarian filling. The service was fast and friendly, and the restaurant's interior was lovely so we'll definitely eat inside the place next time.  The food itself was quite good and came in huge portions, considering we paid around 20 dollars for two meals. My partner got three chicken balls and a container of sauce, and our egg rolls were hot and crispy. I think the best thing we had was the General Tso's chicken, so we shared that and we'll definitely get that again next time. The sauces were all flavourful, the rice wasn't dry and awful, the chow mein was crisp and fresh, and the chicken was tender. The only issues we had with our food was that there were bits of chicken cartilage in the rice (some people like that, I know,  it's just a personal thing), and my partner said that the noodles stuck together a wee bit.   I would probably purchase two dishes next time, instead of the combos-- General Tso's chicken or sweet and sour chicken (or shrimp, or beef!) and a different noodle dish.  Also, if you need cutlery in your take-away bag, make sure to tell the waiter!

Me and my boyfriend were craving some Chinese food, so I yelped the closest location with the best reviews. This one popped up and I'm glad it did. I never really expect too much going to a hole in the wall Chinese restaurant, but this place was good.  We ordered the cream cheese wontons for an appetizer. They came out fast and were fresh! Also, was a big serving.  We came during lunch so we received egg drop soup before our meal as well.  I had the sesame chicken while my boyfriend had the orange chicken. Both were tasty! And again came with a lot of food. Lot of the chicken, fried rice, an egg roll, and two wontons.  Lots of good food and a check of $20. Yes please!  Good place if you're hungry and on a budget.

Chinese has always been a bit of a tricky cuisine for me to review. Admittedly, this is partially due to my own ignorance, thanks to my parents excluding Chinese from the five or six restaurants we kept in continuous rotation during family dinner outings. It also has a lot to do with the fact that Chinese food, at least the American-influenced style we're most familiar with, hasn't really evolved much. Yes, there are corporate chains that suburban families flock to, as well as these so-called "modern" spots that simply replace the dragon dcor with IKEA furnishings and big screen TVs. But is the food really all that different? When you think about it, pizza, burgers, and even Mexican food all have their fair share of changes over the years. But I rarely see or hear about any "high-end" Chinese restaurants, nor have I found much variation in the types of food available. It's all pretty traditional stuff, which is probably why its once exotic appeal has slowly waned in the last fifty years. The fact that roughly one-third of them are always named "The Great Wall" doesn't help matters much.   Wait, where was I? Oh, yes. Dragon Palace. A little family-owned Chinese restaurant that, from what I understand, has been around for quite some time. Located in a seedy looking plaza, it was one of the few Chinese places that popped up with some decent Yelp reviews, so I thought we'd give them a try.  Hey, complimentary tea upon being seated? Nice touch!  My girlfriend and I ordered a sampler platter, which consisted of two wontons, honey dipped chicken legs, egg rolls, and jumbo fried shrimp. Unfortunately, the wontons tasted stale, as if they had been sitting around for far too long. The egg rolls weren't too far off. In my opinion, these are the basic of the most basic items - and if something is wrong with them, that's probably not a good sign. Hell, if the Vietnamese and Thai crew, people that shamefully stole these items from the Chinese menu can do them right, why can't this place?  Our entrees were delivered shortly thereafter, quickly slapped down on the edge of the table by the server - similar to a barista plunking down a couple of iced coffees on the counter before running back to make another drink during the middle of a mad rush.  Typically, when I eat Chinese, I usually play it safe by ordering beef and broccoli and rarely deviate out of sheer fear. However, for once, I attempted to change things up by ordering their Kung Pao Chicken. I took about three bites and immediately surrendered. I still can't put my finger on what it was, but something, whether it be the peanuts, or some kind of strange oyster-like sauce, just gave the meat this very bizarre aftertaste that I strongly disliked.  My girlfriend ordered the chicken chow mein. Half was offered to me out of pity, due to my immediate dismissal of my Pao. It wasn't too bad, but nothing that I would order for myself. Once again, I can't really put my finger on why, it just seemed rather bland.  You also receive the traditional bowl of rice. Eh - rice is rice. I can make it in my microwave in six minutes, but it's there if you want it.  They serve a couple of complimentary banana fritters at the end of the meal, which I'll admit, was a charming move - especially since most Chinese restaurants don't seem too big on offering desserts. They were okay, but probably would have tasted better hot, as fried bananas typically do. Then again, they were free, so I guess I shouldn't complain.  Overall, I was not really impressed, which really now has me wondering who serves the best Chinese food in Phoenix. Allegedly, according to my girlfriend, the best Chinese restaurants are actually found in Mexico of all places - a belief that a colleague of mine also strongly supports. From what I've been reading, there's actually a quiet movement in Central Phoenix to give Chinese cuisine a bit of a boost - although I haven't quite experienced this just yet.  Ultimately, this just wasn't my type of place. Although reading some of the reviews, they seem to have their fair share of longtime fans, so take my opinion with a grain of salt - or in this case, a grain of MSG.

Our favorite Chinese restaurant! Lots of flavor and minimal grease. My husband usually orders beef and broccoli and I always get their veggie egg foo young. Perfect comfort food. Great friendly service too! Slightly pricier than other Chinese restaurants but well worth the quality. And the portions are huge!

I have been going here for 20 years. I am never disappointed, they have the best Hot and Sour soup I have ever had. I have moved to California and every time I come back to Phoenix I always stop in for my fix. The family that owns and runs Dragon Palace are kind and always remember me even when it has been 6 months since my last visit. I always feel welcome they always have a smile and genuine interest in my satisfaction with the meal. Great service, great menu and great prices make this one of my favorite meal spots in Phoenix.

Ordered delivery  Came on time  Cantonese chow mien was great :) not soggy, good mix of veg and meat,  Hot and sour soup... WAS TERRIBLE... good portion and broth.. but it was all broth 2 pieces of tofu and some mushrooms... and I ordered 2. Not happy for 4$ each if was a true hot and sour soup would be great

I have lived in the area for over 4 years and tried this place for the first time tonight.  It was fantastic!  The owners were friendly and the food was delicous and fresh.  I have been searching for a chinese restaurant to call my "regular" place and I think I have found it.  Exceeded my expectations.
Their Chicken fried rice and egg rolls are the best in the Valley!! We have been going their for 20+ years and the food is always sooo good.  It is never greasy and is consistent every time.

Just finished eating take-out from this place.  I can honestly say that the food was extremely flavourful and fresh tasting.  We over ordered as is typical with a new restaurant, but the meal was still quite affordable.  The delivery driver was friendly and fast.  Overall a great first experience!

I have been going here since I was a child (and it hasn't changed at all). I loved it then and I still love it now.  My favorite dishes are the Mongolian Beef and Almond Chicken, but they have plenty of other great dishes. They have a great lunch menu and very generous portions. Come hungry. Their dinners are served family style. The restaurant is a little dark and could use some new, updated decor.  Be sure to check out the huge mural on the north wall.

My boyfriend and I happened to stumble upon this place while we were across at Joe's Grotto. Little red door just in the corner of the complex, but man was it a great discovery! The food here is superb, reminiscent of the Chinese restaurants we frequented when living in L.A. Food is served quickly along with tea. We always get the Peking Dinner because it's such a great value for how much food you get! There's always enough for lunch the next day and you know that Chinese food is always good the next day!

Read the online reviews and now it's the only Chinese place for us! The egg drop is awesome- I only got based on another yelp recommendation, I normally do not like Chinese soups. It's so good! My husband gets the chicken fried rice and I'm hooked on the mu shu pork.

This was my husband's second visit and my first to Dragon Palace.  The first time my husband went he came home excited about having a good Chinese place so close to us (and let me clarify that we are both American born Chinese so we love greasy Chinese food).    I love that right after we sit down they bring the tea, and there's no extra charge like a lot of Chinese restaurants these days.  This place does offer a great deal for a LOT of food -- we went with the Family Dinner special which was 11.95 a person for soup, eggroll, fried wontons, pork chow mein, fried rice, and sweet and sour pork.  By the time the entrees came around we were totally full and we ended up taking three full cartons of food home.  The service was prompt, attentive, and very friendly.    However, I thought that the food here was very difficult to eat.  The chow mein especially was really, really salty.  I never ever send food back but we had to ask for them to cook it again because it was so salty, and it wasn't much better after that.  The sweet and sour pork was deep fried pork with sweet and sour sauce drizzled over it -- not even coated evenly.  The meat itself was tough and chewy in texture.  The fried rice was decent, nothing extraordinary.  My favorite part of the meal was the dessert, they make these fried bananas wrapped in wontons that are coated with honey and they are delicious!  Since my husband had such a positive experience the first time he went, I am willing to give this place another try.  Maybe they just hired a new chef (our server said that he was also brand new) so there may be some inconsistencies in the menu.

One of my Uber eats meals, Uber Eats may be a reason to ever live my house to get mown takeout. So by saying that I can only review the food and not the service or the actual restaurant but none the less this is just good Chinese takeout.  Dragon Palace is what you would expect from a Chinese Takeout place, fast and tasty with huge portions. When I get Chinese takeout I expect a good portion for cheap. We ordered Chicken Lo-Mein, Chilli Chicken, Chicken Pad Thai and Hot and Sour soup.   The Lo-Mein was good typical shiny lo-mein no better no worse then any other place it didn't really stand out but I'd recommend it if you are in the mood for lo-mein.   The Chilli Chicken was stand out!! It was great! Perfectly spiced and still great after being warmed up (twice) if you only wanted one dish this is what i'd suggested. Its some of the best chilli chicken I've gotten from a take out place in a long time. Definitely one of my favourites.  The Chicken Pad Thai was again alright, not too great but its not a Thai restaurant so my expectations weren't that high. I probably would recommend against this since its more just like chicken and noodles.  The Hot and Sour Soup was below average. I have my favourite Chinese restaurants a few blocks north of me and they serve an amazing hot and sour soup so this one was a bit of a disappointment in comparison.  Honestly I can't complain much as its what i would expect from Chinese takeout. I might order from here again but there are a few other places I'd like to try first. I'll be ordering the chilli chicken again for sure though!
Service was great!  Portions are huge!!!! Try the lemon chicken and you will be in love

Since moving back to Arizona from California 5 years ago, we've tried out many Chinese food restaurants in the valley.  This is one of the best that we've found so far.    The decor is a bit tired with a little TOO teal walls.  In fact, when I eat there I find myself thinking of simple ways to update the interior to make the restaurant a bit more fresh and friendly.  Dark decor aside, the service is great, the food very tasty and the prices quite reasonable.  My husband and I often pick up take-out to eat at home and our favorites are the "Sauteed Happy Family", "Crystal Shrimp"  and the "BBQ Sliced Pork" appetizer.  The "Moo Shu Pork" is also delicious and the PuPu Platter for 2 at $7.50 is a smokin' deal!  This spot is well worth a visit if you're in the mood for Chinese food.

My wife and I have driven by this place a thousand times and never gave it a thought because of it's location, a slightly ghetto strip mall.  Thanks to you Yelper's we braved the location.  (on a side note, this ghetto strip mall has an Irish Dance Studio, Fencing Studio, A Toy store that is gotta be seen to be believed and Joe's Grotto featuring a stage for bands.)  Walking through the big red doors entering the restaurant I was suddenly flashing back to childhood memories of my families favorite Chinese restaurant in CT circa 1965.  Same decor, reds, blues, big red banquets, and complete with gold dragon's!    The owner is really nice!  He has been in this same location since 1979.  I only know of a handful of restaurants that have stayed in business in the valley that long.  He gets 4 stars just for that!!  The menu has all the regular "americanized" Chinese dishes....sweet and sour pork, egg foo yung, chow mein, mu shu, etc....will be back again to find our favorites on the menu.  We had the fried dumplings, bo bo shrimp, peking fried rice and house special fried chicken.  Everything was fresh and tasty!   This is one of the better "americanized" Chinese restaurants in town!
Great quality, delicious food. We are so happy to have a great Chinese restaurant close to home.
Probably one of the better Chinese places Ive tried. I love take out and delivery Chinese for some reason, this place was great to eat in. Would highly recommend eating here.

Bland.  My "hot" bean curd was anything but--had to cover it in sriracha.  My husband's hot and sour soup was nothing like any hot and sour he'd ever had (and not in a good way).  The mushrooms looked canned and the chicken in the hot & sour soup was oddly rubbery.  This place over Americanizes their food and it makes me miss east coast Chinese.  We're keeping our hopes up that we'll find "our" Chinese take out place in Phoenix, but the outlook isn't good if Dragon Palace is worthy of 4 stars! One up side: ridiculous amount of food for a really good price.

I have been going to this excellent hole-in-the-wall family run Chinese restaurant for 20 years. I introduced my wife to it a few years ago, and we go about once a month since. It is better than any place else you can find and the prices are excellent. Get the Dragon Dinner Special for enough food for leftovers for days, for $15 a person!
When me and my wife think Chinese food this is the place we go... Always. It's so good and really quick. Never waiting long for your food. Love this place.

We visit this place about once a month.  My husband is a superfan of Dragon Palace.  He absolutely loves their shrimp fried rice.  I love the banana fritter (???? - someone posted a pic of this - not sure of the name) that comes at the end of the meal.  We both love the hot tea that is served with each meal and we always order the egg drop soup.  One of my faves is the beef skewer.  It's beef on a stick that comes out on this thing with fire underneath it so you heat the skewer how you like.  I'm not sure what to call that thing but I love to get my skewers sizzling hot.  I keep trying new items each time I go and some of faves are the Orange Chicken, Pepper Steak and Sesame Chicken.  They serve it with a pot of white rice.  Each dinner entree is served on an oval plate and is enough food for at least two people....more if you eat small.  I always have leftovers, as I order the entrees for myself (hubby eats Shrimp Fried Rice always).  Service is always super fast so you won't have to wait too long for your food.  The staff is nice and the decor is a very cozy Chinese look.  This a little gem in our neighborhood.  See you there!

This place is delicious!!   I have been here a couple of times. Tonight was the first time I ordered take out.  My food was ready in 10 minutes!  They packaged it up with care and added a round cookie and a sugar cookie. I ordered the orange chicken and the crab Rangoon. Both where super delicious. I have plenty left over!!  The orange chicken had nice size pieces of juicy chicken breast lightly breaded and not overly spicy.  I do love the decor in here!!  It's quirky but that's what makes it cool!  The only bummer about take out is you don't get the wonderful banana wontons everyone raved about but I'm sure they'd throw it in if you asked!!  Love this place!!

Unfortunately, our food (Green Pepper Beef & Shrimp Egg Foo Yung) was very disappointing last night. Therefore we will not be returning to the Dragon Palace. The beef in the Green Pepper Beef did not even taste like beef and the chunks of green pepper were too large and the flavor didn't blend very well with the dish. The patties in the egg foo yung were dry and tasteless. The service was good but the place was freezing. I know the valley has had its share of  cold weather lately but even the servers were wearing jackets & sweatshirts & the bench in the booth was ice cold! I had heard great things about this place and really wanted to like it but it was not to be. The search goes on for the type of  american style chinese food in the valley I prefer.

Just went there for dinner with my husband, Sunday night, not too busy. Service was ok. We ordered dumplings and teriyaki beef sticks as appetizers, it was pretty good. Then came the entrees, pork fried rice was just ok (some rice not fully cooked at the bottom of the plate) Crispy duck .... $13 entree to get a bunch of pieces of over fried duck put on a plate, mostly fried skin and bones. They cut the bites with the bones in it, so you either have to pull the meat off or spit the bones chunks out as you're chewing on it... I was so disappointed after a good start with the appetizers. Won't go back, overpriced. Still on the hunt for a good Chinese food place.

My family and I have been coming to dragon palace for more than twenty one years. We have never ordered anything that was not delicious. The people that serve the food are very friendly and very welcoming. I like the lemon chicken in my mother likes the shrimp with lobster sauce. My dad likes the Mongolian beef and my friend likes pork chow mein 5 stars
Quick service , but nothing write home about.  Food bland, nice portions , but nothing was tasty.  Just...blah...

Visited Dragon Palace while visiting my daughter in Phoenix.  Service was quick and courteous.  Food was okay, nothing spectacular.  Not the best I've had, but definitely not the worst I've ever had.  I would come back here again for a safe meal when I'm in the mood for Chinese food in Phoenix.

The food here is absolutely horrible. We had issues with every thing ordered except the iced tea. The food is completely unflavored, salty, and low quality.  We ordered the Mandarin family dinner which was a bundle of appetizers and entrees. The issues listed below were addressed with the manager/owner but he made excuses for the problems and did not attempt to correct. I would not recommend this restaurant in any way shape or form to anyone for fear they will be disappointed or sick.  The issues 1. Fried wontons - cold, hard and no filling.  2. Egg rolls - filled with old meat and tasted awful.  3. Egg drop soup was really thick from over cooking 4. The fried rice was full of old and new meat (complemented by the light and dark colors plus an old taste) 5.  The Mongolian beef was the most offensive in taste - super salty and watery (the manager said that's how they do it there). 6. The sweet and sour chicken tasted like donuts deep fried in old oil. The shell of the pastry was crisp but every piece was doughy.  Topping the chicken was a sweet glaze but did not complement the chicken.  7. Stale fortune cookie  The dinner was finished with some odd baklava looking sweet but we were so done with the restaurant that we didn't try it.

Some of my favorite Chinese food in town for sure!   Located in a small ghetto looking strip mall in northern Phoenix, Dragon Palace comes off looking like ever other mom and pop place on town. However, let it be known this is the place to try. Even if it is a bit of a drive for you, it is worth it.   Their food quality of above most places that are comparable in styles. Their menu is huge, anything you could possible want they have, and if it isn't on the menu I am sure the adorable little old man that waits on you will do his best to make you want you want. At lunch time they have a great deal for around $6 you get your choice of entree item that comes with soup, won tons with sweet and sour sauce (my fave!!), an egg roll and either white or brown rice. Way more food than one should eat at once. Not to worry though, the reheating factore is wonderful in this situation!   Check them out. Also, while you wait for you wonderful yummyness to arrive, check out your Chinese horoscope, interesting stuff! :-)
Favorite place in town I recommend the Mongolian beef or beef chow mein also hit n sour soup !!

WORST customer service we have EVER received!!! Trust us, the food is NOT worth the horrible service that is provided. I am extremely disappointed in the way that we were treated as customers here. We ordered our food 45 minutes before they closed. The lady continually harassed us on our drive there with multiple phone calls. We arrived (well before close) and were told that they apparently had closed 30 minutes earlier than what not only their website said but also what the lady had confirmed with us on the phone. We will NEVER eat here again. And advise that you do not either.

This was always one of my favorite go to places, but has lost some of its appeal. The food quality is what I would classify as average, not great. Staff is still very friendly. Place is clean. And reasonable prices for a meal. Take a chance, see if you like it. If you do, go back, but if you don't, skip it next time

The only reason this place gets 4 instead of 5 stars is the location. It was hard to find and the parking lot was completely packed. Maybe reserve a few spots out front for take-out customers? But, the food is so good here, I'd park down the street! Again, Chinese take-out is VERY hit or miss in AZ. This place reminds me of home (NY). I have tried a lot of asian restaurants in the Valley, and Dragon Palace posts up at the top spot! Fast, friendly, and reasonably priced. Try the Peking Fried Rice or Chow Mein, so good. The Orange Peel Beef, and Sesame Chicken are to die for. Beef/Shrimp with Snow Peas, and the House Special Chicken/Shrimp is great. The War Wonton is the best I've ever had. And honestly, I would never have tried this place if not for the other reviewers. The fact that this place has been around this long, and customers have been coming here for years and years and always satisfied; I had to try it out. So glad I did, thank you! This IS my place for Chinese now and later. Really happy to have found this little gem. :)

When you're hungry but want to stay in? Dragon Palace is the answer! The delivery takes about 45 mins but was all worth it! The serving were big enough for 3-4 people for 1 dish. Cantonese chowmein was delicious. I find the crispy ginger beef too sweet. The spring rolls were nice and crispy not soggy. Everything was hot when delivered! I was very satisfied with my order!

The food was passable. The dining room was nearly empty at 7 pm on a weeknight. Not that I crave a crowded and noisy dining experience, but it would've been nice to think we'd made the right choice eating there by seeing other diners voting with their wallets.  I don't think our waitress spoke any English beyond what was on the menu. She had to go get help from another waitress when I ordered a whiskey on the rocks. Even the more fluent of the two didn't think to ask me what kind of whiskey, so I was served rail that tasted like the ice cubes had come from a moldy dispenser.  The food was ok. Nothing special. I had the kung pao chicken. It lacked spice and came loaded with onions (which I had asked them to leave out).

My wife is especially picky about Chinese food and she was very pleased - thus, there is joy in the world.  Exactly as describe in most of the previous reviews... run down looking location (has character;) however the food is really good, when compared to PHX competitors it shines even more. Go and enjoy!

Went here last month with my friend. We were so hungry! Greeted fast, sat down and a table we got to pick. Order the pou pou platter to start and it was amazing. Consisted of about 5 mini apps and two of each. For example, two spring rolls, 2 teriyaki wings... for dinner my friend got sesame chicken and I got moo shu chicken. Amazing, flavorful and can not wait to come back.

My husband and I grabbed take out from here and it was really good! Great service, prices seem to be reasonable compared to others as well. The meat in the fried rice and Lo mein was all really good quality. The food wasn't greasy, and had a lot of taste compared to other Chinese restaurants that seem to have the same taste for everything. We will definitely be ordering from here again!

This is not a 4 star Yelp restaurant. I use Yelp weekly and this has to be one of the most overrated restaurants I have ever gone to based on Yelp recommendations. The food was mostly inedible. Just awful.

We had a craving for Chinese food this Friday evening in Paradise Valley AZ, so we searched the Internet and came up with DRAGON PALACE, and we're glad we did!  We ordered the Peking Dinner for Two, which included Wor Wonton Soup, Pu Pu Platter, entrees of Mongolian Beef and House Special Chicken, with Peking Fried Rice. I also ordered an appetizer of BBQ Sliced Pork.  Even though the restaurant was crowded, service was really fast - our food was delivered quickly, and everything was delicious - and HUGE! We took home several portions. We were surprised when the check came with fortune cookies and 2 delicious honey-coated wonton skins with a banana slice inside, on the House.  Yummy! Definitely recommended.
Very good food service very friendly highly recommend it  I got the crispy beef it was awesome

Wow - a lot of 5 star reviews on the Dragon Palace.  I suspect many are giving heavy handed reviews as this is a "sentimental" favorite.  I guess even my rating is slightly biased that way too.  But 5 stars people?  Meaning it cannot get any better than "woohoo, as good as it gets"?  Ok, I'll end my rant and get to the review.  In short, this is your typical old school Mandarin/Szechuan style chinese restaurant.  Decor is slightly tired, but who really cares about decor anyways for a neighborhood chinese restaurant?  Staff couldn't have been friendlier.  It's family run (from what I gather) and take out service is quick and efficient.  They include almond cookies, sauces, utensils, and fortune cookies in a nice packet with your to go order.  Everything was packaged VERY well.  The menu is a diverse variety of your typical chinese items.  Be aware that some dishes (like the Moo Goo Gai Pan) have alternate names (like "Snow White Chicken").  Still with me?  Good...on to the food.  I ordered BBQ pork slices, Kung Pao Chicken, and a dish they called "Bo Bo Shrimp".    The BBQ pork slices were generally not too fatty as they can be other places, however some pieces were sliced too thin as they were dry.  Also, the seasoning did not permeate the meat that much.  There was also no "sauce" (which is good, because Char Siu should not have any sauce per se).  Maybe I'm just spoiled with good BBQ pork, and I also realize it's just an appetizer, but could have been better and more flavorful.  The Kung Pao Chicken is very average.  First I'm appreciative of chinese restaurants that use dark meat instead of white as it's not dry.  But add to that a lot of peanuts that were a little overpowering (I felt like an elephant), lots of cubed green pepper and onion, and a lot of sauce made this the typical Kung Pao chicken.  Was it bad?  It wasn't bad, but not 5 stars great either.  I don't know if I really understand why Phoenix area chinese places are compelled to throw a ton of vegetables in Kung Pao.  It'd be nice for once to have a relatively vegetable-less "meat" dish and order vegetables separately (like how you order at better chinese places).  Compared to other places in Phoenix, it was probably better than what I've had, but again, not 5 stars "amazing".  The Bo Bo shrimp was a breaded shrimp dish with a spicy brown sauce.  On the positive, I tasted the ginger and garlic come out of the sauce, but the breading on the shrimp was so heavy it was falling off as I ate it.  Perhaps it was because it was take out and it got soggy, so I'll reserve some judgement for when I dine in person, but I've had plenty of take out and the shrimp are not always like that.  I would have preferred a lighter coating which can be achieved with a dusting of cornstarch.  I can see why this place has gotten the accolades because relatively speaking, there isn't a lot of good accessible chinese food here in Phoenix (well, unless you go to Cofco Plaza, Lee Lee Market, Great Wall, etc.).  But again, there is much better around.  With that being said, if you've read my other reviews you'll see I am a big fan of locally run non-chain restaurants.  So don't let my review scare you too much, I'm just picky and have high expectations.  I certainly could have ordered items that are difficult to make poorly (Mushu pork, mongolian beef, etc.) but chose Kung Pao as it's difficult to pull off properly.  So please try this place for yourself and form your own opinion.  At least you have mine.
Best Chinese in Phoenix for real. You MUST try the egg foo young. It is amazing! If you're vegetarian the family bean curd is also delish. The owners are awesome and we always enjoy our visit!!!!

FIRST TIME HERE.  The place is in a beat up shopping complex.  Nothing scary- just old.  The inside was lovely for a Chinese restaurant.  Loved the hanging lanterns and the dark red seats and all the gold wood wall hanging which displayed various Chinese dragons.  It felt like a restaurant in china-town (but clean).  Bath rooms probably need a good in the cracks cleaning--- but overall it was clean.  (The kindof clean you want a restaurant bathroom to be in... get my drift?)  Best crab puffs in the area! Yum, you get 8 cream cheese filled pffs for 4.95.  The egg drop soup ($4.00 for a large) was flavorful and really thick--- a little too thick for my preference and full of celery.  My husband raved about it, thought it was the best ever.  We also ordered the Sizzling Rice Soup ($7.25 for a large), would've been knocked out of the park with flavor, ingrediants, however, the cook added too much salt.  Kids ordered a large egg fried rice sans the peas/carrots.  It had a great buttery/bacony flavor to it.  Wow--- so good.  Our entree was the Honey Walnut Shrimp for $11.95.  Shrimp tasted fresh, no funky flavored shrimp.  The sauce was light and when I say "light"  it was tossed perfectly.  Shrimp to sauce ratio was spot on.  The shrimp was lightly battered, no tempura shrimp here.  The walnuts came a little light, could've used a little more but it was about 15 large shrimps on the platter.  They priced it right for what you got.  It's your standard American chinese food.   Will definitely be back.  It was good..... if my soup wasn't so salty I probably would've given it 4 stars.  I"m thinking this was even 3.5 star establishment.
I've been coming here since I was a little girl and nothing ever compares to it. It's a family favorite and always requested by my kids.

We've been going here since i was kid in the early 80's.  a few months ago, i ordered some mong beef for lunch and it was terrible.  i then read an article a few days ago that DPalace received an A+ on their inspection.  So, for nostalgic purposes, i took the fam there for dinner last night.  IT WAS AMAZING.  They definitely redeemed themselves from the last visit.  Dragon Palace is back in my rotation.  the only thing that i wasnt satisfied with is that they changed the recipe of their BoBo Shrimp.  the old recipe was waaay better.  Nonetheless, this a great chinese restaurant and glad to have it in our neighborhood.

The first time I ordered take out from this place, it was DELICIOUS! I couldn't of asked for more.  I ordered again last night for the second time (also take out) and I was very disappointed. We were shorted some white rice, the Sesame Chicken was very dry, and the little bit of sauce that was at the bottom had a large layer of drippy oil on top. There was also an egg shell in my Egg Drop Soup. The Special Beef item was just O-K. My boyfriend said he wasn't impressed how the beef was cooked, as it was too chewy. Really thought I found the best Chinese place near me, but apparently this is not the case!

We've gone here twice and liked it much better the first time compared to last night. Service is odd. Both times the servers were abrupt and it feels like they just throw cups and plates in front of you. Last night they also brought soup and food at once which made us feel rushed.   Our first visit, we tried wor wonton soup, kung pao, and walnut shrimp--it was all pretty good, and flavorful though the kung pao seemed to be only peanuts and chicken. I'd give it 4 stars. Last night we came back for the soup and tried a few appetizers.  Everything was fine, but generally lacked flavor (except the honey chicken wings which were GREAT).  Throw in the service, and we're just not sure we'll come back...
Honestly the best Chinese food ever. The egg rolls are to die for and the crab puffs are amazing.

I called Dragon Palace one time when I was really hurting for some quality Chinese food. I ordered the house special and something else that way my bill came out to the appropriate delivery amount.   Delivery was a little late, and I'm just 2 maybe 3 blocks away which kinda ticked me off (I was starving!). The dish was absolutely delicious except the chicken was still in huge pieces that I had to cut down.   All in all I liked the food but I think I'll actually go inside next time to experience the ambiance.

This is my third visit to Dragon Place and I have to say from the first visit to the last one i am really underwhelmed with the food. The first time it was really good and flavorful. The second time I was not overly impressed as I was on my first try but this last time I was disappointed in the overall flavor. I ordered the general tso's chicken and egg rolls. The general tso's chicken was mushy and a little over cooked. The egg rolls honestly didn't seem like they had been freshly cooked. I really wanted to like this place because it comes highly recommended and this is just my own experience but I'm pretty sure it won't be my go to place for Chinese food.

I've been coming here for the past 6 years for take out or eat in.  Mostly I do the Take out, which the food is exceptional!  Food quality is great, and I'm always happy with my meal.  I recommend the Moo Shu Pork or Shrimp.  Pupu Platter Excellent.  On top of that this is a hardworking family owned business and the whole family is really nice and they always remember you and make you feel welcome.     Highly recommend!
Really good Chinese. We end up here about once a week. The owners are very nice. The food is consistent and typically good. We've had a couple off visits, but that's an exception and not the rule.

Menu looks like every single chinese takeout place on the east coast and they aren't pretentious.  Clearly I'm not in California anymore.  Fantastic.  This place made me pretty dang happy.  It's rot gut chinese.  Boom.
Egg rolls were good, food was hot and ready for pick up.  The sweet and sour pork was edible but that's about it. The shrimp egg foo yung blah.

This is the BEST Chinese restaurant I've found in the entire United States. Their cherry sauce cannot be duplicated. They egg rolls are perfection. Their Moo Shu Pork is outstanding. Their chicken dishes always hit the spot.   I've been eating here since I was 10 years old and I'm so glad this place is still in business 23 years later. Looking at it from the outside, you might not expect it to be such a hidden gem. But it is!  Great food the bigger chains and trendy Chinese spots just cannot compete with! I LOVE this place!

I wish I had a throw up emoji to put on here. My boyfriend and I ate here about a month ago; it wasn't amazing but not bad. Tonight my boyfriend ordered the walnut chicken and duck. Oh my gosh please do not put yourself through the pain of eating here. There was a chunky white sauce on the chicken that I swore was chunks of lard. It was so bad my boyfriend tried to put rice and soy sauce all over it to make it edible. I finally gave up after a few bites and ate left overs instead. Sorry dragon palace but I am pretty sure you are going to make me feel very ill in the morning.

I totally love this place. It reminds me of the old school hardcore Chinese restaurant my parents used to take us when we were kids :D   The decor is amazing- unlike more Chinese places in Phoenix. The walls are a teal blue, adorned with large carved pieces of artwork depicting scenes in China, golden dragons and more. The lights hanging from the ceiling are amazingly ornate. The place looks like its from a bygone era (doesn't help that its in a run down strip mall) but it is clean and charming inside.  The service was great- kind to our 2 yo, and very attentive. The food was the best part- I can't remember the last time I had such good Chinese food, and it's priced very reasonably. We got the Peking dinner for 2 which included the fried noodles, hot tea, wonton soup (with generous noodles, meat, shrimp and veggies, the best I've ever had), a pupu platter with eggrolls, bbq skewers, house wings and those cheese puff thingies (the presentation is pretty cool, too). Next came 3 entree sized plates of food: mongolian beef, fried chicken (can't remember the name) and the Peking fried rice. The meal concluded with incredible little desserts- sort of like eggrolls but filled with banana and then covered with crystalized honey. I could have eaten 100 of them! Adding in a beverage and tax, the meal was only $34!   My 2 yo can really eat, so I am surprised and pleased to say that even with sharing the dinner for 2 people with him, the 3 of us walked out with lots of leftovers. Highly recommended. Do it! DO IT!

When I moved to Phoenix I tried several Chinese restaurants and none of them were good. I was beginning to think I wouldn't be able to find a go to place out here. Then, I found Dragon Palace. Don't let the sketchy shopping mall deter you!  Consistently fast, hot, fresh food. You also get huge portion sizes, so you're paying for your lunch or dinner for the next day or two as well.   I've always dined in because not only are they quick, but you get complimentary hot tea and little banana fried wonton things at the end of your meal. Hard to describe but they are so good.   I've never gotten take out before but they must do well with that too as I always see people coming and picking up food while I am there. Service is always prompt. Sure, you aren't getting any small talk from the servers and they are to the point, but I'm not looking for a drawn out meal when I eat at a place like this. Highly recommend!

We have been going to this restaurant for over 34 years, it's our favorite Chinese.  Love the free tea, and the sizzling rice soup is one of our favorites.  Recently tried another Chinese place in downtown Phoenix and was disappointed and thought that it's about time I give this place the rating that we feel that it deserves.  The meals are large and we always take a box or two home. Lunch prices are a great deal too.  Nice staff - we love this place!

Great food and attentive servers! This place was a fantastic choice for a midweek dinner. Everything we ordered was tasty and fresh! Definitely recommended for all... my 7 year old granddaughter enjoyed her mea, especially the wontons they brought at the end for dessert.

I've been searching for a Chinese restaurant close to home that my husband and I can enjoy regularly. A meal out at a Chinese restaurant was a weekly treat for me and my family when I was a kid but I've struggled to find a decent option close to home here in AZ. Dragon Palace is exactly what I'd been looking for.   Love the Mongolian Beef and the Wor Won Ton soup. The House Special Chicken was different than any I'd tasted before, but probably not my favorite version of the dish. The lunch specials are amazing and I'm so happy they offer them on Saturdays. Start off with egg drop soup and crunchy noodles; then the entree of your choice, fried rice, egg roll and won tons plus hot tea. My meal was $6.45 and I was stuffed.   My dislikes: they don't open until noon on Saturdays. I'm an early bird ready for lunch by 11:00 a.m. usually. But worth the wait anyway. They served my husband's meal a good 3 minutes before mine which we felt was weird. The fried rice was only so-so. I like veggies in my fried rice.   All in all, I'm happy I found this place and that is thanks to the reviews of my fellow Yelpers!

Really good Chinese. I myself have pretty specific standards when it comes to Chinese food and Dragon Palace definitely meets those. The chicken wasn't bad or chewy like some places you will find and the egg rolls and crab wontons were amazing. The only thing I would say that could be improved is the flavor of the Kung Pao. It was good but was not very spicy and was a little on the bland side. Other than that this will definitely be a place I will go to again.

House special chicken is a must. This is not a fancy schmancy place so you know the food will be good! Never have had to wait for a table. The banana thingies they give you for dessert are awesome too. I give it 5 stars because of the huge selection. Pei Wei and PF Changs are ok but they have a limited menu. And a LARGE wait!

I was so excited about this place based on the reviews.  I am looking for a good Chinese delivery place in Etobicoke.  I ordered spring rolls, Cantonese Chow mein, house fried rice and sweet and sour pork.  The spring rolls are excellent.  The house fried rice as well.  Cantonese Chow Mein was average...noddles were overcooked.  Sweet and sour pork...well the breading wasn't terrific.  I will give it one more chance and update the review if it improves.
Love this place, very clean and good service... first time coming and I totally will came back!!
Our go-to Chinese restaurant in Phoenix!  Must try the crab puffs, happy family, Mongolian beef, and moo shu.

So glad to have found this place hidden in a dive of a strip mall (aren't all  places in strip malls in Phx?). Hey, it allowed me to finally find Joe's Grotto too.  Dragon Palace provides quick, thorough, and friendly service. Very well packaged to-go orders that keep you from having sauce spill out all over your car. I've tried a few dishes and found that they can sometimes be a bit bland, but overall it's quality Chinese food. I happen to be addicted to the Mu Shu Pork. I was surprised they wrap the crepes before packaging, but it really seems to allow the flavors to blend together and they're just plain good.  I had been really disappointed with not being able to find a decent Chinese takeout place in Phoenix and Dragon Palace is just what the doctor ordered!

Mediocre  !!!! Overpriced save yourself the disappointment & money . I order the house special chicken & sweet & sour chicken with 3 PC egg roll . First disappointment was you can't purchase just one egg roll you have to purchase 3 @ 3.95 then if you want to upgrade to fried rice it's $6 that's crazy !!! So I passed on that I went to go pick up. As they do not deliver I got there and was presented with a bag smaller than a grocery store bag so I asked where the rest of order was the women said it's all there. I got hm & there were 4 small food containers 1 box for egg rolls , 1 box of house special chicken , 1 box sweet & sour & 1 box of rice !!!! One box for both entrees we got one small box , I was pleasantly surprised to see almond cookies a nice touch it so I thought after taking a few bites of dinner my husband & I threw out the food & I tried to eat the almond cookie & thought I was  going to chip my tooth it was do old and hard a total waste of $27.00 won't be returning.

We literally order Chinese food once a year because, well, you know... it isn't the most healthy opiton out there. BUT!!! My good Lord is it delicious. Enter Dragon Palace. Very friendly staff, amazing food. Don't be deterred by the sketch strip mall - give this place a try.

The food was hot and tasty...only thing was delivery was a little slow, but it was likely cause it was so cold and valentine's Saturday.  FINALLY a yummy Chinese food delivery restaurant in Mississauga! :)

If you want solid, consistent plentiful Chinese food in a casual atmosphere this is the place for you.  This is our local go to for Orange Chicken and Szechuan Shredded Pork.  We have been going for years.  The restaurant changed hands a few years back and we worried it would go downhill-but not so!  This family run operation still offers the same quality food and the portions are fabulous.  The Orange Chicken is the BEST anywhere-and they use chicken breast.  They do loads of take-out too.  Try it!

This place rocks.   The house chicken is great.   Kids love the noodles.   Awesome little diveyy Chinese place with amazing food. It reminds me of the one my mom used to take us to when we were little kids.

Overall, like everyone has been saying so far, huge portions, good quality food, friendly service, and not to mention affordable!  All my friends said I had to try this place before I leave for the States and I'm glad they did! What stopped me before was the long commute from Scarborough to Mississauga, but it was worth it. Drove there during rush hour with 2 buddies for dinner the other night and ordered 3 dishes to share and soup and still had leftovers. Portions were definitely huge, we purposely ordered less cause we wanted dessert after but ended up not finishing everything.  The food was also very tasty and everything was hot and fresh. The crispy beef was real crispy, and the ginger didn't overpower the dish. Chilly chicken had a nice heat to it and it was soooo tender. The fried rice we got was perfect, the rice wasn't sticking with each other and they didn't skimp on the shrimp and pork. We were skeptical of their wonton soup at first so we ordered only one, but ended up ordering 2 more because it was so good! They didn't skimp on the wontons and there was pork in the soup too! The waiter told us that they make their own wontons in house. Everything came out super fast, within 10 mins our table was full of food.  They were also very accommodating. We were craving for Yeung Chow fried rice but it wasn't on the menu, they still made it for us. Best Yeung Chow fried rice I ever had. You can tell the chef knows how to use a wok. Dragon Palace you should definitely put this on the menu!  I'm definitely going to try to hit this spot up one more time before I leave to the States! Hidden gem in Mississauga!
Clean restaurant, great staff, very pleasant and welcoming.  Service fast, courteous and accommodating.  Food was fabulous!!!

I came here for dinner a few weeks ago after reading the reviews on yelp.  I was pretty disappointed and won't be going back.  I got a cup of the wonton soup as an appetizer - it was pretty pathetic.  The wontons had a dime-sized amount of meat in each one, and the broth was awful.  I got sesame chicken and wasn't impressed with that either.    To top it off, the family that owns the place let their small child run around the entire restaurant and in and out of the kitchen screaming, with the teenaged hostess (also a family member) hardly bothering to try to quiet her down.  The waitress just went and sat at a table next to the kitchen staring at me the whole time.  What the heck?  Atmosphere gets a zero.

I have had highs and lows with this place. I think they are the best deal if you go for lunch. the honey walnut shrimp is my favorite their soup is delicious I preferred dining in to take out though I think it's a better deal.
Always delicious! Orange chicken is a must have, they use real orange peels in their sauce.

Bring your appetite. They feed you like your starving. Staff was on point with what you expect from a chinese restaurant. Food just as good, chicken was a bit dry but spot on for flavor. Mongolian Beef was perfect.  We did the peking family meal. And the Zombie drinks were great. Planning to make this our goto for chinese food. With tip whole meal came to $60ish for 2. Now onto home for a food coma.

So glad this new restaurant opened in Sharpsburg! Got take-out during their first week in business and it was the best I've had in the Pittsburgh area, even though I've been to a couple of pretty good Chinese restaurants in other parts of greater Pittsburgh. The hot and sour soup was spicy and flavorful (I always judge a Chinese restaurant by their hot-and-sour since everybody makes it), and my Chicken with Eggplant had just the right amount of spice/ sweetness. Generous portions, good service. I will definitely be returning, and I hope they are able to maintain this level of quality!

I just had the worst experience at a restaurant ever!! Not only did my mother and I get an attitude from all the employees the moment we sat down but we were being rushed thru our dinner. We ordered the Peking dinner for two with a side of assorted veggies and all of our food was brought at pretty much at the same time. Pu pu platter was brought out then immediately the soup was brought out. I had time to eat one item off my pu pu platter when the veggies followed immediately by the house special chicken were brought out. After asking why we were being rushed the owner said "no rush" and took the chicken and veggies back. After having a chance to catch up to the food on the table, the platter and the soup, they brought out the chicken and veggies. Which were barely room temp but then again it was pretty cold inside there so I will say ice cold. They asked us what we wanted to do and we told them leave because they had ruined our Christmas Eve dinner which had been a tradition of going out for Chinese since my Grandparents were alive and I was a young kid. After completely ruining our dinner they demanded us to pay for the pu pu platter and soup. We paid for it all the while listening to every excuse as to why we were getting an attitude and being rushed thru our meal. I have been going to this restaurant 25+ yrs and have never had this kind of service. I will never step foot in this place ever again!! They actually deserve no star at all!!
